Title: Farm Manager
Content:
JOB DESCRIPTION: Responsible for overseeing the care of all animals in the care of the program and farm repair and maintenance as needed 

ACCOUNTABILITY: This position reports to the Executive Director

REPORTS TO THIS POSITION: Horse Care Specialists, Barn Care Volunteers

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE (BUT NOT LIMITED TO):

  1. Overseeing the feeding of horses, chickens, goats and any other animal under the care of the organization. 
  2. Post feeding instruction in the feed room so equine care staff know current grain, medications and supplements to feed at each feeding. 
  3. Procure feed, medications, hay, manure removal, and bedding from approved sources as needed to ensure no disruption in care for the animals and program activities. Work with the Executive Director and Clinical Director to determine vendors to use and arrange for payment. 
  4. Contact horse sponsors to procure special feed, medication or necessary equipment for donor-sponsored horses as needed. Give a minimum of 1-2 week’s notice before it is needed.

 

  1. Arrange veterinary and farrier care as needed to keep animals healthy and sound. 

 

  1. Fill shifts for equine care staff or help arrange another person on the team or contractor to fill shift(s) as needed.

 

  1. Train new equine care staff on farm’s procedures, safety, expectations, mission and programs to ensure they are equipped to handle assigned tasks and animals and operate without disturbing programming, clients and program staff.

 

  1. Give immediate and specific feedback about performance to equine care staff as needed to ensure safety and high-quality work is performed. Discuss any negative behavior, safety issues, harsh treatment of animals, lack of quality work or excessive tardiness and/or absence from work immediately. Inform Executive Director if a second warning or discussion occurs regarding performance by equine care staff member. 
  2. Clean, water and drag the arenas or assign to someone who is approved to operate the tractor as needed to prevent excessive dust and hard footing 
  3. Ensure horses have access to clean, fresh water in stalls and pastures 
  4. Ensure all stalls are cleaned thoroughly and bedded as needed. 

 

  1. Ensure all manure is dumped in manure dumpster. order and coordinate dumpster swapping.  Notify Executive Director before ordering dumpsters to ensure payment is arranged. 

 

  1. Determine when blankets and sheets are required to keep horses comfortable in turnout or stalls and communicate with equine care staff. 
  2. Install and remove fans, heated buckets, heat lamps in chicken coop and other weather related equipment as needed to keep animals healthy and comfortable. Replace equipment as needed.

 

  1. Ensure hay is available in stalls and pastures to ensure horses have access to hay as needed.

 

  1. Ensure all gates, fences, stalls, arenas, round pen are in good working order and are repaired as needed. Keep a list of repair projects and assign to maintenance person or qualified volunteer to complete. 

 

  1. Sweep and cobweb barn aisles and tack room as needed to keep free of debris and looking good for clients and tours.

 

  1. Work quietly around clients, therapists or riding instructor when present. This may require adjusting your work to ensure privacy for clients working with a therapist.

 

  1. Identify future projects and process improvements that should be undertaken to improve efficiency or care of the facility.

 

  1. Utilize company technology programs including salesforce, Theranest, and Google workspace to manage and track horse usage, scheduling, and staff communication. 

 

EXPECTED HOURS AND COMPENSATION:  This is a part-time position, expected hours/week 20-25

 

QUALIFICATIONS:  Extensive horse experience required, including knowledge of horse behavior, working safely around horses and how to clean stalls. Ability to lift and carry 50 lbs. Ability to work independently and perform multiple tasks on time. Ability to supervise equine care staff and volunteers. Ability to operate a tractor or learn.

 

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ABOUT THIS POSITION & ORGANIZATION: 

We are a small and nimble organization. Team members wear many hats. You will be expected to work independently, meet all timelines and perform all required tasks. We are looking for someone who can take initiative and keep the Executivel Director informed of any issues with the animals, equipment or facility that require additional attention. It is an opportunity for someone who wants to have a career in stable management or therapeutic horsemanship.

Title: Seasonal Trail Guide
Content:
Lawton Stables inside Sea Pines is looking for a seasonal trail guide to join our operation for Summer of 2024! We are a unique horseback riding facility offering 1-hour guided Western trail rides through a local Forest Preserve for adults and children 8+ years old, pony rides for children 7 or younger, carriage rides, a small animal farm, and a gift store. We are open 6 days a week, offering 3 rides per day in the winter, 4 rides in the spring and fall, and 5 rides a day in the summer.

Trail Guides are a vital part of our organization. Trail Guides are responsible for the friendliness, safety and competency our visitors experience, as well as the safety, care and public display of our horses, animals and grounds. Duties include operating Lawton Stables’ trail rides, pony rides, animal farm, maintenance, cleanliness, and care of the animals, including regular vet and farrier coordination, and regular farm duties. As Lawton operates on a resort facility, trail guides are required to work throughout the busy periods, including summer and holiday periods. The safety and consideration of our guests is paramount, along with the safety and consideration of our employees, as well as for the animals under our care.

Requirements for our trail guides are as follows:

  • 18 years old or older
  • Experienced rider with extensive riding experience
  • Fit and agile to mount and dismount with ease and without blocks/steps
  • Capable of riding up to five hours a day
  • Excellent customer service; friendly and personable
  • Enjoys working with children
  • Able to maintain professionalism during pre-ride preparation and instructions and during all interactions with customers
  • Able to assist guests while mounting and dismounting
  • Capable of thinking, acting and reacting quickly and maintaining a helpful attitude during demanding and sometimes stressful situations
  • Proficiency in grooming, tacking, untacking, cleaning, feeding and watering
  • Able to lift 25-40 lb. saddles on and off horses
  • Able to lift and/or carry up to 50 lb. hay bales and grain bags
  • Enjoys working around a farm with regular farm duties (repairing fences, regular maintenance duties, cleaning pastures, barn, keeping water clean, etc.)
  • Able to maintain good working relations with coworkers
  • Housing may be available for the right candidate

Title: Home Groom/ Head Groom
Content:
We are seeking a professional who prides themselves on turning out happy, healthy, well-groomed horses. Candidate has successful experience as a sole-charge Groom, Head Groom, and or Management position.  They have strong awareness of self and their surroundings and are ready to bring their expertise to a professional and rewarding environment. This is a Live-In position with shared night check responsibilities and vacation coverage.

The ideal candidate has a seasoned toolbelt with warmbloods, bring patience, a sense of humor, an agile mindset, are observant, and maintain a tidy barn. Thrives in a calm environment and truly seeks to connect with their equine charges. Must have experience at the upper levels in Showjumping or Dressage.

 

The Equine Professional

  • Work one on one with owner and operate independently 1-2 days/week and when owner is travelling.
  • Implement daily individual nutrition programs, exercise plans, therapies and administer medications.
  • Be responsible for inventory control, ensuring that supplies and equipment are well-stocked and organized. This includes managing, hay, shavings, feed, medications, grooming supplies, and other necessary items.
  • Share night checks and holiday coverages as part of your responsibilities.
  • Must be able to regularly lift 50 lbs.
  • Required Skills: • Experience with Warmbloods and sensitive types • Groundwork • Grooming • Equine first aid IM & IV • Stall cleaning (shared work) • Self Aware • Growth Mindset • Tractor skills • Drivers license • Drive Horsebox •
  • Exercise riding based on experience.

Title: Groom/Rider
Content: Looking to add someone to our team! The ideal candidate would have experience with horses of all ages, advanced flatwork skills, and happy to perform all aspects of horse care and riding. Summers in Rye, NH and winters in Ocala, FL. Housing is provided in both locations

Title: Executive Director
Content:
Summary of Responsibilities:
This position is responsible for the overall operation and management of GAIT EAS in keeping with its
mission: To improve the quality of life of children and adults with special needs through equine activities
and therapies resulting in a more independent life in society. This includes its staff, riders/participants,
volunteers, horses, and facilities. Responsibilities include: staff supervision, equine assisted services
program development, community outreach and collaboration; GAIT EAS’ budget planning and
implementation; managing therapeutic riding programs according to PATH International standards, with
the utmost attention given to safety.
REQUIREMENTS:
 Minimum bachelor’s degree, master’s degree preferred.
 Minimum 5 years’ experience in business, nonprofit preferred.
 At least 2 years of management experience.
 Equine knowledge and experience, years of owning, riding, teaching preferred, but not required.
 Ability to network in the community for participants, funding, grants, fundraising, and goodwill.
 Experienced in social media and digital technology.
 Excellent writer for newsletters, newspaper releases, brochures, grants, public addresses.
 Complete all required employment background checks.
JOB DUTIES:
Assume primary responsibility for daily operations: facility maintenance, security, safety, staffing,
horse health, volunteer training and coordination.
Supervise all staff: full time, part time, and volunteers.
Work with the GAIT’s Board of Directors for financial stability.
Know and implement GAIT Policy Handbook, reviewing and revising annually.
Know and familiarize yourself with PATH International standards, Board of Directors Manual, GAIT
business plan, staff job description, GAIT EAS Volunteer Manual, GAIT brochures, and update regularly.
Know and implement PATH International standards to maintain GAIT EAS’ status as a Premier Accredited
Center in the nation.
Always know and implement the mission of GAIT EAS and in all places.
Ensure all visitors are not only welcome at GAIT EAS but accepted as they are.

Contact Info:
GAIT Equine Assisted Services: 314 Foster Hill Road, Milford, PA 18337
Office: (570) 409-1140
All resumes should be emailed to info@gaittrc.org

Title: Groom/Barn Manager
Content:
Team Tate Dressage is Hiring!  We're looking for an exceptional professional groom for our world-class dressage training program.

This full-time position oversees all aspects of the care of our horses. We are looking for a self-starter who can also follow directions, has sound judgment, and keeps things neat and tidy.  Outstanding communication skills, being considerate of others, and a positive attitude are a must. 

This position requires previous experience with competency lunging and handling horses of all ages and levels. The ideal candidate will be reliable, organized, efficient, competent driving a truck & trailer, and a nonsmoker. Previous equine vet tech experience is a plus. 

Winters will be in Wellington, FL, and summers in Landrum, SC. There is the possibility for international travel with the horses as well. 

We offer a competitive salary, housing, PTO, and a fun, friendly work environment. At this time we cannot sponsor foreign workers; American citizens only.

Please email a brief description of your qualifications to TeamTateDressage@gmail.com.  We will not respond to DMs.

Title: Associate Director of Patient Care and Patient Facilities
Content:
This role is a specialist within animal health e.g., infection prevention, audit, quality assurance, safety. Under the management of the Director of Clinical Care Technicians and Patient Care Facilities will manage a team of 7 Clinical Care Technicians and a team of 10 Patient Care Attendants. Position located in Kennett Square, PA.

Under the management of the Director of Imaging and Clinical Services, this position will manage a team of 7 Clinical Care Technicians and a team of 10 Patient Care Attendants. The job requires oversight of 6 barns to include 100 stall maintenance. This job requires that you have a solid grasp on horse handling, animal husbandry, maintenance of patient facilities equipment and the ability to guide staff through very difficult and sometimes dangerous situations.

Job Responsibilities

  • Manage the Clinical Care Technicians and Patient Care Attendants
  • Maintain all patient housing with the assistance of the Director of Facilities to include all disinfecting between patients, stall and barn maintenance
  • Maintain and repair all equipment to be used by staff
  • Maintain an inventory of all patient care supplies, feed and bedding material.
  • Provide all necessary training to the staff in accordance with biosecurity standards, training related to radioactive materials and biohazard waste
  • Ensure that there is coverage 7 days a week by formulating a monthly schedule.
  • Responsible for employee recruitment, performance management (including improvement plans) and scheduled PTO utilizing Workday software.
  • Provide onboarding and schedule training for employees as needed
  • Provide teaching to Veterinary students and Harcum students
  • Perform additional duties as assigned

Under the management of the Director of Clinical Care Technicians and Patient Care Facilities will manage a team of 7 Clinical Care Technicians and a team of 10 Patient Care Attendants.   • Bachelor of Science degree and 5-7 years of relevant experience or equivalent combination of education and experience is required

  • Experience working in a large animal hospital preferred
  • Ability to work with the HR department in staff management, hiring, terminations, and disciplinary actions
  • Exceptional leadership, great communication (both verbal and written) and excellent problem-solving skills is required

Title: Groom/Support Staff
Content:
Looking for an experienced groom/support staff. This is a full time live on site position for a single person. A typical day includes feeding, supplements, medications, turnout, blanketing, stalls and general barn maintenance. No drinking, drugs or smoking. Compensation includes a  private room and bathroom/all expenses and salary.

Interested applicants can send resume to debbiejamsa@happysdreamranch.com. Must be ready to work.  This is for immediate hire.  References required. We are located in beautiful Prescott Arizona. No international applicants please.

Title: Part Time or Full Time Horse Feeder - Mansfield GA
Content: ISO part time or full time Horse Feeder at Dabney Gentle Horsemanship. Horse experience required, applications accepted from workers age 16 and up, beautiful facility with 30 horses, friendly staff, 4 miles south of I-20 just east of Covington, GA. This job includes feeding 30+/- horses each with different recipes and some with special instructions. Our feeding system is automated. You will be using a golf cart. We have automatic waterers in all pastures and paddocks so no dumping and scrubbing troughs. We have a machine you will pull behind the golf cart that picks up manure.. Pay is $12 per hour. References required. No smoking, drugs or profanity. web site - www.eddabney.com Please email resume to: ed@eddabney.com

Title: Wrangler
Content: Wranglers are responsible for the care of our horses, programs, and corral facilities. They will assist in the development of age/experience level-appropriate curriculum and activities. Wranglers will also teach lessons, lead trail rides, oversee the Frontier Program, and teach campers how to interact with and enjoy the horses safely.

Title: Assistant Trainer
Content: Assistant trainer position in a professional dressage training barn. This is a riding role but will include shared barn responsibilities such as feeding, turnout, grooming and tacking horses (but no stalls). Rider will have opportunities to train on an average of 4-6 horses per day with coaching from head trainer, and will also have the chance to teach lessons and develop training skills. Rider will be expected to work as a team player for the barn's needs with fellow grooms and barn manager for a 6 day work week, 7am-4pm. Many opportunities for growth under an already proven program with amazing clients, wonderful horses and kind fellow staff. Competitive salary consummate with experience and housing on the farm can be provided.

Title: Equestrian Camp Counselor and Barn Specialist
Content:
Our Equestrian program is hiring for Summer 2024! YMCA Camp Tecumseh offers a variety of
horse programs for our campers from trail rides to riding lessons for beginner to advanced riders
and are looking for dedicated, hard working staff to join our team to provide those amazing
experiences! Learn more and apply. https://www.camptecumseh.org/jobs/summer-staff/
Following our extensive training, all of our equestrian staff will prepare and give riding lessons to
campers ages 8-15.
Our Equestrian Cabin Counselors will serve a dual role of being an instructor and an
Overnight Cabin Counselor to a group of 10 girls each week. You will also participate in
traditional camp activities from swimming to cookouts to games and much more. Dates for
training and summer run from May 19 - August 10.
Our Barn Specialist role will be more hands-on in the care of the horses and our small petting
farm while still providing lessons and interacting with the campers on a daily basis. While this
role does not involve living in a cabin, you’ll be living on site in a suite style building with other
support staff. This role has the opportunity to be broken up into two different sessions if one is
unable to commit to the whole summer. Dates for training and summer run from May 13 -
August 10.
Neither role requires an extensive horse background as we are looking for dedicated,
responsible, outgoing applicants who desire to work with horses and children and are able to
function well with a team. We will provide the training needed. Room and board provided for
both roles. Applicants must be at least 18 years of age to apply.

Applicants must be at least 18 years of age to apply.

Title: Horseback/Equestrian Instructor at Summer Camp!
Content:
Summer Job Opportunity!!!

[PLEASE NOTE: Location is listed as PA, but we have multiple camps across the East Coast region still hiring.]

Looking for a job teaching kids equestrian skills? Our premiere group of camps are actively hiring horseback staff for Summer 2024. You will work, play, and live in a structured outdoor environment as a summer camp activity specialist, emphasizing a sense of fun, family, friendship, and belonging. 

Benefits:

  • Room and Board
  • Food and Meals Provided
  • Paid Days Off
  • Staff Only Gear
  • Laundry Facilities
  • Valuable Leadership Experience
  • Networking within a Large and Diverse Staff and Alumni Community

Salary:

  • Typically, summer camp activity specialists can expect to make $300 – $400 a week during the summer, or around $1,400 for a typical 4-week session, and $2,100 – $3,200 for a typical 7-8 week session. Salaries depend on credentials and experience and vary from one camp organization to the next.

Most of our camps are on the East Coast of the USA.

Get more info & apply now: https://www.americansummercamps.com/work-at-summer-camp/activity-specialists/

Title: Horseback Riding Instructor
Content:
Individuals seeking Full or Part time positions teaching horseback riding lessons to a special population of adults and children over 5 years of age.
Prefer PATH International Certifed Therapeutic Riding Instructors (or those seeking certification) to join a thriving and growing Therapeutic Riding program on the Emerald Coast Panhandle in Florida!
Seeking self-motivated individuals who work well with others, demonstrate compassion, comfortable serving adults and children with disabilities, limitations, or challenges and has a willingness to learn!
Lessons are currently offered Tuesday-Saturday with flexibility where needed.
Pay is competitive with national average.

Title: Head Groom
Content:
We are currently in search of a head groom for our small, competition hunter/jumper barn. Groom responsibilities will include:

  • Cleaning Stalls
  • Turn out / bring in
  • Feeding
  • Grooming, Clipping, preventative care
  • Tacking up
  • Stable maintenance (sweeping, cleaning buckets, etc)
  • Setting jumps

Depending on skill/hours, job may also include mowing grass (zero turn mower), dragging ring, painting jumps/fences, cleaning tack, etc.

We have on the property anywhere from 9-12 horses at a time, that rotate turn out. We are a fairly private barn, with a few clients who occasionally come for lessons, but mostly are horses are ridden by our two on site riders. We show at the Kentucky Horse Park shows during the spring & summer, and may occasionally travel to WEC Ohio. We also regularly attend the Winter Circuit at WEC Ocala from January - March.

We are looking for a reliable self starter who is interested in a low-drama, quiet barn to work at.

Title: Instructor and/or feeder/mucker
Content:
Paid instructor position open at Saddletree Stables. Great group of instructors who help each other and a friendly work environment. Growing program with horses from beginner-advanced. We have hunter jumper, dressage, and basic western horses available. Primarily a hunter jumper barn. On-site schooling shows and local shows throughout the season. You can make your own schedule however must work at least one weekend day. Housing available and allow pets. Opportunity to board horse on property. Located in Willow Spring, NC just under 20 miles from Raleigh.
Feeder/Mucker position available as well. Feeding includes feeding, watering, and haying all horses on the farm. Mucking is super simple and “relaxing” put in your headphones and muck away. Shifts available all throughout the week/weekend.

Title: Stable Hand & Herd Manager
Content:
We are seeking a reliable and experienced Stable Hand to join our team. As a Stable Hand , you will be responsible for assisting with the daily operations and maintenance of our farm and stables. This is a hands-on role that requires physical stamina, knowledge of farm work, experience with horses, and a love for working with animals.

The position will start as a Stable Hand position with the opportunity to grow into the stable's Herd Manager. Additional income opportunities for stall cleaning shifts. Additional opportunities for training and trail guiding for the right person.

Duties:
- Perform general maintenance tasks around the farm, such as cleaning stables, repairing fences, and maintaining equipment
- Assist with feeding, grooming, and turn out of horses
- Handle and restrain animals safely and efficiently
- Administer basic medical care to animals under the guidance of the barn owner and a veterinarian
- Perform basic repairs on farm buildings, fences and equipment
- Utilize hand tools for various tasks around the farm
- Keep accurate records of animal care, feeding schedules, and maintenance activities

Experience:
- Previous experience working on a farm or in a similar role is preferred
- Familiarity with equine handling techniques and safety protocols
- Prior horse experience and be comfortable handling all types of horses

Requirements:
- Must have reliable transportation -- no on site housing available at this time
- Ability to be self-directed and pro-active
- Ability to perform physical tasks such as lifting heavy objects and working outdoors in all weather conditions
- Basic math skills for measuring feed portions and calculating medication dosages

Compensation:
- $15/hour starting wage + commissions and shared tips
- Unlimited riding access and free riding lessons.
- Additional income opportunities available.
- PTO/Sick Time

If you are passionate about working with animals, have experience in farm operations, and enjoy being part of a team dedicated to providing excellent care for horses, we encourage you to apply. This is an opportunity to join a dynamic organization that values hard work, dedication, and a commitment to animal welfare.

Painted Bar Stables is a large and busy recreational horse farm in Burdett, NY. The stables is located just off of the Seneca Lake Wine Trail in the Finger Lakes Wine Country. We are looking for a motivated individual to join the team to help care for our 40+ horses as we play host to over 3,000 riders and students a year.

Our farm hosts public trail riding, adult and youth lesson, boarding, distance/endurance riding and breeding programs.

The facilities consist of a well groomed trail system, outdoor arena, small indoor arena, round pen, 35 box stalls, 10 tie stalls, 4 run-ins. Our farm is home to a variety of horses of different ages, temperaments and training stages. Most of the horses on site are owned by the farm, but we also have a handful of boarded horses owned by others.

Title: Working Student
Content:
It’s that time again! Each year we look for our next Working Student who’s ready to take the first step into professional work in the horse industry. For 2024 we will be looking for two new members for our Lake o’ the Woods Sporthorses team:

1. Working Student:
*Start date will be May 2024, with prior stipended training period TBD*
Boutique, private, 8 horse classical dressage and sales operation an hour north of Raleigh, NC seeks our next Full Time Working Student. The position is a short-term contract, generally one year. Candidate should be a competent, intermediate rider, enthusiastic to learn more about French Classical Dressage. Most important is that the candidate is able to care for the horses to a high standard, and comfortable with sole-charge horse management.
Candidate must be able to perform stable duties (lifting up to 50 lbs, confidently handling horses on the ground), also help with occasional farm maintenance when needed (hay season, paddock and arena maintenance) and be a motivated individual who can work independently. Candidate should be able to demonstrate leadership, responsibility, communication skills. Willingness to learn and enthusiasm for the work are more important than experience. However some farm experience with Tractors etc., would be an asset, a clean driving license is required. Any veterinary experience is also a plus.
Benefits: Private, on-site housing, Non-smokers only, limited pets and zero drug policy. You will also have access to all estate amenities (gym, pool, tennis court etc.) Also included: local cell phone, all utilities (internet, heat, electric, etc.) access to farm vehicles; trucks and trailers. Weekly day off plus up to two weeks paid vacation, other time off negotiable and yearly bonus. Stabling and board for one horse including farrier (not included: vet bills, meds, supplements, feed that isn't currently carried here). 2 to 3 lessons per week, although often as many as 5, time permitting, and ample additional daily riding options. Opportunities to clinic and to show at both schooling and recognized USEF/USDF/USEA competitions. Access to our professional networks when you are ready to launch into the horse industry for your next position. Our prior working students have gone on to be professional riders, assistant trainers, instructors, grooms for elite facilities, and saddle reps, you are welcome to speak with them about their experience here.
Salary: Approx. $1000 in take home pay per month, on top of the included private housing and board, with a modest increase if the applicant does not bring a horse.
Working schedule is 6 full days a week - hours per day highly dependent on the season, and what is happening that day (i.e. show or travel, vs. at home), but generally 8 until 6 with a lunch break. There are opportunities to make additional income if willing to do extra work, with outside training horses, construction, and with the property's wedding business. We are quite flexible and consider anyone working for us family.
It's a very unique opportunity for the right person. You can visit our website to see the manor house and wedding venue, and some shots of the horses: www.lakeothewoodsestate.com See more about our current sales horses at our equine site www.lakeothewoodssporthorses.com To apply please email a CV and cover letter to lotw.clinics at gmail dot com

2. Summer Intern:
The Summer Intern works directly with the Working Student to assist in the daily tasks of running the barn. Feeding, turnout, laundry, mucking, general cleaning, grooming, tacking etc. In exchange for each full day of work the intern receives one 45 minute lesson. Additional riding opportunities, including schooling, hacking, and showing are available for qualified candidates. The Summer Intern also receives a small weekly stipend to cover expenses, access to a farm vehicle, and private housing in our pool house. This position is perfect for a young person just looking to get started in the horse industry. Exchange for college or high school credit is also possible. Interns will leave with written recommendations, an entry into the professional horse world, a solid classical dressage foundation and many marketable skills in various aspects of the horse industry. Internship length and start date is flexible, but the candidate should be available at least one full month, with preference given to someone available 3 full months. We sometimes also accept shorter term interns on a rolling, as-needed basis, so if you're looking to join us for a few weeks or a month any time of the year, don't hesitate to reach out, we may be able to accommodate. To apply please email a CV and cover letter to lotw.clinics at gmail dot com

You can visit our website to see the manor house and wedding venue, and some shots of the horses: www.lakeothewoodsestate.com See more about our current sales horses at our equine site www.lakeothewoodssporthorses.com To apply please email a CV and cover letter to lotw.clinics at gmail dot com

2. Summer Intern:
The Summer Intern works directly with the Working Student to assist in the daily tasks of running the barn. Feeding, turnout, laundry, mucking, general cleaning, grooming, tacking etc. In exchange for each full day of work the intern receives one 45 minute lesson. Additional riding opportunities, including schooling, hacking, and showing are available for qualified candidates. The Summer Intern also receives a small weekly stipend to cover expenses, access to a farm vehicle, and private housing in our pool house. This position is perfect for a young person just looking to get started in the horse industry. Exchange for college or high school credit is also possible. Interns will leave with written recommendations, an entry into the professional horse world, a solid classical dressage foundation and many marketable skills in various aspects of the horse industry. Internship length and start date is flexible, but the candidate should be available at least one full month, with preference given to someone available 3 full months. We sometimes also accept shorter term interns on a rolling, as-needed basis, so if you're looking to join us for a few weeks or a month any time of the year, don't hesitate to reach out, we may be able to accommodate. To apply please email a CV and cover letter to lotw.clinics at gmail dot com

Title: Working Student Position
Content:
Working Student Position available:
We are a boutique style Eventing facility located in Indian Trail, NC in search of a full time working student to start in April ‘24. We have a high standard of care and our training focuses on strong and correct basics for both horse and rider to build and keep confidence through the levels. Applicants must have a good work ethic and be a team player with prior horse knowledge and be willing to learn how we do things.
Perks:
✅ Housing available
✅ Bring own horse (with 6+ month commitment)
✅ Lesson horse provided if you do not have your own horse.
✅ Opportunities to compete
✅ Opportunities to earn money by providing secondary services to boarders (bathing, clipping, massage gun and Accuhorse Mat therapies)
✅ Daily lessons
✅ Possible Stipend for someone truly invaluable to the team.

The job:
🦄 Feeding, turnout/bring in, stalls (10 max).
🦄 Grooming and tacking
🦄 Show grooming or sole charge when I’m away.
🦄 Baby sitting*** I have an infant daughter that is a constant fixture in the program and while I ride you must be comfortable and competent helping with baby duty.
🦄 General Farm upkeep chores.
🦄 6 days a week, roughly 8-4 if you bring your own horse. If you do not bring a horse we are happy to accept 5 days a week 8-4. Hours always depend on exact lessons or show schedule or if we’re working around the weather.

I already have a summer working student lined up so this is a 6 or 12 month commitment. Applicants must be 16+ years of age and have their own reliable transport if they are not living on site. I do require references from previous trainers or barn managers (or your vet) and a short riding video. And in the essence of fairness, any serious applicant should feel free to ask for my previous working student’s references for me and my program and what the work environment is like.

Please pm or call/text Coti at (704) 441-3497

Title: Groom/Barn Manager
Content:
Groom/barn manager position available at Ashley Trier Eventing, a full service eventing business.
Currently a part time hourly position but could turn into a full time salary position for the right candidate.
Duties include:

- Bringing in and feeding horses

- Grooming/tacking up/untacking/cooling down

- Keeping barn laundry rotating and the barn clean and organized

- Some riding may be available to the right candidate

- Not a stall mucking position but may need to pick up a pitchfork occasionally

Clean environment to work in and a dedicated, fun atmosphere with good people.

Title: Riding Instructor
Content:
The Red Pine Camp riding program teaches English balanced-seat riding.  We ride camp type horses on the flat in our arenas.  We use all English saddles and bridles with egg-butt snaffles.

Qualifications

  1. Sixteen years of age or older
  2. Current CPR and First Aid certification or willingness to obtain these (will be offered during our pre camp training)
  3. The ideal candidate:
  • Must possess knowledge and performance skills of balance seat equitation (English)
  • Horsemanship experience equal to or equivalent of 4-H requirements
  • Previous background of riding, training, or showing horses
  • Stable management knowledge and horse care background is necessary
  • Genuine love of teaching campers safe, correct, and required riding skills
  • Will partake in our pre-camp in-service training program of riding instruction and teaching

Abilities and Character

  • Enjoys people and horses and has a sincere interest in helping girls (ages 7-15) learn to understand horses and ride with confidence.
  • Demonstrates awareness of safety concerns with campers and handling horses.
  • Always uses appropriate treatment of horses.
  • Utilizes various teaching methods to address camper learning styles.
  • Demonstrates professionalism in class handling and all forms of daily riding instruction.
  • Possesses enthusiasm, creativity, flexibility, fun to be with and a good sense of humor.

Dress Code and Appearance

Safety of campers and horses is our primary concern.  Proper attire worn around horses contributes to a safer experience with horses.  Instructors serve as role models and dress professionally for all teaching and riding duties.

  • Either tall riding boots or short boots with half-chap
  • Breeches, jodhpurs, or riding tights.
  • Riding shirts, blouses, sleeveless shirts, or t-shirts
  • Riding gloves and work gloves
  • Riding helmet
  • Warmer riding attire for cooler days and inclement weather

Responsibilities

  • Follow all Red Pine Camp policies and procedures
  •  Follow all Red Pine Camp Riding Department policies and procedures using the ‘Team’ approach.
  • School green horses before campers arrive.  (These horses are winter pastured and need a breaking-in program by riding staff the first week.)
  • Be familiar with all emergency procedures in the ring and on trails.
  • Follow Red Pine Camp Riding Program’s curriculum and creatively teach our riding level requirements while keeping safety of campers and horses your priority.
  • Attend pre-camp Riding In-service program and willingness to advance your own personal riding limitations.
  • Be familiar with riding records of returning campers and conduct new rider evaluations for class placement.
  • Be responsible to the Riding Director as teaching duties and stable management tasks are assigned.
  • Attendance at Riding Staff meetings for updates and daily scheduling.
  • Additional schooling of horses when necessary.
  • Daily maintenance of stable, horses and all riding equipment in a clean organized manner.
  • Setting up the barn and equipment during pre-camp as well as closure of facilities.
  • Learn Red Pine riding trails prior to leading campers on trail rides.

Title: Riding Instructor with Jumping experience
Content: We are a busy Lesson Barn that's looking for two instructors to teach Mostly English and some Western horseback riding and horsemanship, to all ages. Jumping knowledge is a plus. We are located in Vacaville. The position starts part-time. The instructor must be experienced, at least 24 years old, Have a positive attitude, responsible, professional, and like to work with people. Days are flexible we are looking for 1 to 2 days to start - we are open 7 days a week. Position available immediately, serious inquiries only, please! Contact Ellen at 415-895-8615 by texting or by email, topiaryfarms@gmail.com  If You Don't List a Phone Number on Your Resume or Your Email I Won't be Able to Contact You for an Interview.  Looking to hire immediately!

Content:
🏅Grooming position available 🏅

We are a sales and training operation based out of Wellington FL, Middleburg VA, and Nancy France. Title: Barn Foreman/Assistant Barn Foreman
Content: Sky Lodge Christian Camp in Montello, WI is looking for two college aged girls with strong horse handling skills and riding ability to come and work with us for the summer.  The position(s) include daily barn chores, managing a small barn staff, guiding trail rides, helping with girls horse camps and assisting with all horse related activities.  The position is approximately 10 weeks from mid May to mid August.  A weekly salary is included along with room and board.

Title: English Riding Director
Content:
Equestrian Director - relocate to Maine for the summer!
Being a staff member at Laurel South is far more than a summer job. It’s an unforgettable experience in beautiful surroundings, and a rare opportunity to reach your full potential by helping others reach theirs. Laurel South is a down-to-earth place where you will meet and make friends of all ages – from all over the world – and form bonds that will last a lifetime. Most of all, it’s a place where a family feeling is encouraged and both campers and staff are urged to be themselves.

We are located on the gorgeous Crescent Lake in Casco, Maine. You will live and eat for free at camp - all housing and meals are provided. `

Our Riding program features 9 horses and a full outdoor facility. Instructors are responsible for teaching as well as caring for the horses.

Riding is an optional program and campers elect to participate two or three times per week. Safety is paramount. The program is instructional, balanced and fun with the focus on fostering a love of horses.

Campers learn the essentials of riding and have the opportunity to progress to advanced levels of horsemanship. There are occasional riding shows. Horse care and stable management are also important aspects of the program.

This is a two month commitment June 2nd - August 13th.

Title: Groom for Western Show Horse Barn
Content:
Reining show barn looking for a groom to take care of 5 shows horses and 1 mini.
Based in Lexington, Kentucky. Job does include housing on-site. Well behaved pets may be considered.
December 15th - April 15th (approximate) in  Loxahatchee, Florida with housing provided in Florida.
This job entails:
Full care of all horses, including but not limited to:
Turning out and bringing in horses
Blanketing
Stall cleaning
Barn cleaning
Daily show grooming
Tacking up and untacking
Cleaning tack
Following a feed and hay schedule provided by owner
Riding is possible for experienced riders
Other duties as assigned
Job is 6:30am to 4pm Tuesday through Sunday with some flexibility with agreed upon changes by management or owner. Night check (giving hay, picking stalls and changing clothes based on weather) 5 nights a week (8:30pm).
Benefits include:
Housing
One week paid vacation after the first year of employment.
Health insurance provided after 3 months.
Competitive salary based on experience.
Experience:
Must be legal, own a car, have experience with show horses (hunter/jumper, dressage or western disciplines) and be dependable and responsible.

✅ some tractor driving

✅ managing weekend staff schedules

Title: Paid Internship- Virginia
Content:
iso: PAID INTERN APPLICANTS:

.

EQUIMAR, Middleburg, Virginia

This elite classical dressage training stable located in Aldie, VA is ISO one individual. Working Intern will provide upkeep and care for up to 10 dressage horses in exchange for a paid $400 weekly stipend, housing, utilities, and more: housekeeper for the private apartment, board for your horse, weekly mounted lessons, classical dressage education program, school master lessons, paid vacation, signing bonus, relocation assistance and even more.

.

EQUIMAR is a newly constructed facility that has been well designed for functionality and efficiency, producing horses that regularly school all the the movements through the Grand Prix as well as developing young horses.

.

Specific working routine tasks include:

-Basic daily chores (feeding, overnight turnout year round, daytime stalls year round, etc.)

-Providing show quality turnout of all horses on training days (grooming, tacking, clipping, braiding, basic first aid, tack cleaning, laundry, etc.)

-Facility cleaning (dusting, vacuuming, small projects, tractor and water trailer operations, etc.)

.

Additional Requirements:

-Positive and cheerful attitude a MUST!

-Physical demands of this job may include: long periods of standing and walking, heavy lifting and extended exposure to outdoor weather elements.

.

Housing:

Modern, luxury, clean, private entrance and large private housing / no roommates. Utilities, wifi, house keeping service, etc, are provided for a single individual, no space for families or pets at this time. Dogs may be considered on a case by case basis.

.

Required Hours:

M- off

T- 8am - 4pm

W- 2pm - 4pm

Th- 8am - 4pm

F 8am - 4pm

S 8am - 6pm

Su 8am - 6pm

.

This position is supported by three additional part-time staff that clean stalls on many days.

.

EQUIMAR is a prestigious working environment and is happy to provide references from past and current staff.

.

**********EMAIL FOR APPLICATION: britton.equimar@gmail.com**********

Title: Part-Time Farm Help Wanted
Content:
*Join Our Team at Moonlight Equestrian Center!*

*We're Hiring Part-Time Horse Enthusiasts!*

Are you passionate about horses and looking for a rewarding job? Do you have prior horse experience and a strong work ethic? We're seeking dedicated individuals to join our team at Moonlight Equestrian Center!

*Responsibilities:*

- AM feed & turn out
- PM turn in and feed
- Stall cleaning for our 20+ horses
- Paddock mucking for horses turned out 24/7 (2 paddocks & 2 sheds)
- Water management (dumping, scrubbing, & refilling)
- Filling hay bags for stalls & sheds

*Perks:*

- Work off Boarding or Leasing fees
- Learn about various breeds, sizes, & personalities
- Holiday Pay for working on holidays
- Opportunities for growth & teaching lessons

*Starting Pay:*

- Dependent on experience & availability

*How to Apply:*

- Text Hana at 207-200-0308
- Email hpoulin@alumni.unity.edu
- Visit our website: http://www.moonlightequestriancenter.net

*Note:*

- Please, no visas. Our farm is not set up for that type of employment.

Title: DRIVER/WAREHOUSE
Content:
HIRING - DRIVER/WAREHOUSE

Small, locally owned company, located off Leestown Rd lexington Ky hiring immediately. We are looking for a reliable driver/warehouse staff member who is concerned with customer satisfaction and transporting items in a safe and timely manner.

Warehouse work to include receiving and dispatching merchandise to and from the warehouse; load and unload outgoing and incoming delivery vehicles; select products from the warehouse, load and secure goods to pallets, move inventory to delivery area and load merchandise. Driving duties require loading, transporting and delivering items to local horse farm clients or business in a safe and timely manner.

Requires the ability to walk, drive, lift and carry heavy items over 50lbs.

Health, Life, Vision & Dental Paid Benefits curently

Completion of background investigation and drug screening

Requires driver's license and clean record

Occasional over time is necessary, at time and a half

  • Home each night
  • Health, Life, Vision & Dental Paid Benefits
  • Requires loading, transporting, and delivering items to local horse farm clients or businesses in a safe, timely manner
  • Requires the ability to walk, drive, and regularly lift and carry heavy items over 50 lbs
  • Completion of background investigation and drug screening

Title: Full-time Therapeutic Riding Instructor (CTRI)
Content:
Windridge is seeking a motivated full-time Certified Therapeutic Riding Instructor (CTRI) to work with children, adults and veterans outside of Longview, TX. Position available immediately as we are growing!

  • Successful candidates will be passionate about people, teamwork, teaching, and caring for horses and possess a commitment to excellence.
  • Windridge is a PATH, Int'l Premiere Accredited Center that operates on 43 beautiful ac. with pastures/trails/pond, sensory trail & large covered arena.
  • Position involves adaptive/therapeutic riding instruction & support, horse care & training, volunteer supervision, feeding rotation, help with facility maintenance & other duties as needed.
  • Job also includes computer use, ability to lift 50+ lb regularly, Saturday shift for part of year, and good communication skills.
  • Includes PTO, paid holidays, PATH Int’l membership, CTRI cont. ed. & renewal, & CPR/first aid certification.
  • Salary commensurate with experience.

Contact Celia Bower at celia.windridge@gmail.com or 903-797-2414 for more information and to submit your resume to join an awesome team!

Title: Head Groom
Content:
I am looking for someone who wants to join our fun, horse-loving, hard-working, team of professionals as the Head Groom for my Team Dream Training Center (www.myDHF.com) in Lebanon, OH.
The right candidate will be my right-hand person and will receive education and experience relating to every aspect of the business. We specialize in developing dressage horses and their riders through the levels. We are not a sales barn or a young horse development facility, so the riding opportunities are limited to your own horse and some hacking, depending on the candidate's riding proficiency.
As with any job within our equine industry, success and longevity only happens for those who truly LOVE horses, because this is a demanding career choice, but oh so rewarding.
We pay salary, provide onsite housing, board for one horse, and lessons. Only US citizens and valid work visa holders accepted; papers will be required and screened.
For info about me, check out my site: www.JenniferTruett.com
So, if you are a person who has a ‘can-do’ work ethic, loves to learn, enjoys being a team player and LOVES HORSES please contact Jayne Petruska at jayne@mydhf.com or text 608.279.5878

Housing may be available to the right person.

Title: Equestrian Barn Supervisor
Content:
The Forest Preserve District of DuPage County provides opportunities for people to connect with nature. We offer to the public 60 forest preserves, 166 miles of trails, 47 miles of rivers and streams, and 6 nature and cultural centers. We have 6 million visitors each year.

The District's mission is, "to acquire and hold lands containing forests, prairies, wetlands and associated plant communities or lands capable of being restored to such natural conditions for the purpose of protecting and preserving the flora, fauna and scenic beauty for the education, pleasure and recreation of its citizens."

Job Summary

This position coordinates stable operations, provides oversight of equine health care and coordinates the daily operations of the Danada Equestrian Center.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Supervise assigned personnel in stable operations and horse care.
  • Perform administrative and recordkeeping duties related to the facility and programs including horse health records.
  • Coordinate the volunteer program, update the training manual, develop safety policies, organize recognition activities, and train volunteers.
  • Plan, develop and conduct equestrian events and workshops.
  • Facilitate procurement and upkeep of supplies, which involves the transportation of materials and District equipment among District sites.
  • Oversee and coordinate all professional equine health care providers. Administer injections and monitor vital signs of horses. Perform basic and emergency care of horses.
  • Coordinate the operation of the facility and perform related chores, such as fixing fences, mowing fields, and moving manure, which involves the operation of heavy equipment.
  • Provide ongoing feedback, coaching, and counseling in a constructive manner, and confront challenging situations directly with a positive approach, aiming to support and mentor employees in their development and progress.
  • Resolve and rectify issues, prioritize based on gravity and urgency, analyze the root cause, gather relevant information, develop and evaluate viable solutions, decide on the most effective and logical solution, and plan and execute implementation.
  • Supervise staff, including hiring, scheduling, and assigning work, reviewing performance, and recommending salary increases, promotions, transfers, demotions, corrective actions, or terminations.
  • Foster a working environment that promotes safe work habits; Become familiar with and observe all applicable safety rules, policies, and work procedures; Follow all safety rules that pertain to the duties performed and support all aspects of the District's safety and risk management program; Keep work area clean, orderly, and free of hazards; Immediately report all unsafe conditions and incidents.
  • Maintain a supportive working environment and demonstrate a desire to exceed the expectations of internal and external customers.
  • Perform other duties as required.

Requirements:

  • Technical Training in Equine Science/Management or related field; 4-6 years of related experience with 1-4 years of direct supervisory experience (Includes: training and coaching, responsible for preparing evaluation, assigning work, responsible for work of employee supervised); or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.
  • Ability to obtain a Class A (CDL) Commercial Driver's License within six (6) months of employment.
  • Knowledge of stable operations and horse farm management, including pasture maintenance.
  • Competence in developing, preparing, and delivering equestrian education programs to various age groups.
  • Valid Driver's license in good standing.
  • Must have and maintain CPR, AED, and First Aid certification or obtain upon hire (training provided).
  • Must have and maintain Illinois Mandated Reporter certification or obtain upon hire (training provided).
  • Knowledge of general equine care and handling methods, including behavior, anatomy, and the ability to recognize signs and symptoms of injury and illness.
  • Understanding of occupational hazards and adherence to safe work practices.
  • Proficiency in working with tools and equipment, including power tools.
  • Proficient in documenting observations in a thorough and objective manner.
  • Effective communication skills, both verbally and in writing.
  • Demonstrated ability to exercise sound judgment, especially in engaging with others and responding to animal behavior problems and emergency situations.
  • Comfort and competence in working with and around potentially dangerous machinery and farm equipment.
  • Capability to work in close proximity to potentially dangerous and unpredictable animals.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, allowing for courteous, respectful, and productive interaction with supervisors, fellow employees, volunteers, visitors, and participants.

Pay: $60,715 - $68,349 annually

The Forest Preserve District of DuPage County is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace built on a foundation of respect, integrity, teamwork, and excellence. Our organization provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

 Full Job Description

Title: Equestrian Program Assistant - Intermittent
Content:
The Forest Preserve District of DuPage County provides opportunities for people to connect with nature. We offer to the public 60 forest preserves, 166 miles of trails, 47 miles of rivers and streams, and 6 nature and cultural centers. We have 6 million visitors each year.

The District's mission is, "to acquire and hold lands containing forests, prairies, wetlands and associated plant communities or lands capable of being restored to such natural conditions for the purpose of protecting and preserving the flora, fauna and scenic beauty for the education, pleasure and recreation of its citizens.

 

Job Summary

This position performs horse care, assists with the operation of the stable, and provides equestrian programs to the public. The role conducts programs at Danada Equestrian Center that includes, but is not limited to, group and private lessons, trail group lessons, and camp programs. This position also helps train the horses for the various programs.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Inspect horses for injury and perform first aid.
  • See to the well-being of the horses including exercise, training, and conditioning.
  • Assist with the production of special events and provide program information to visitors.
  • Safely educate riders following the directions of official training.
  • Teach and assist riders to gather horses, groom, tack and untack, put up horses properly, and supervise younger students to ensure proper handling.
  • Continually develop the riding skills of students from all experience levels ranging from basic to advanced.
  • Assist with keeping the general appearance, maintenance, and security of riding equipment.
  • Demonstrate a genuine love of horses. Treat them with passion, respect, and instill this feeling into students.
  • Foster a working environment that promotes safe work habits; Become familiar with and observes all applicable safety rules, policies, and work procedures; Follow all safety rules that pertain to the duties performed and support all aspects of District's safety and risk management program; Keep work area clean, orderly, and free of hazards; Immediately report all unsafe conditions and incidents.
  • Maintains a supportive working environment and demonstrates a desire to exceed the expectations of internal and external customers.
  • Perform other duties as required.

Requirements:

  • Must be 18 years of age or older at the time of hire.
  • High School Diploma/GED, 1 - 3 years of related experience with less than 2 years of experience as a lead worker in the daily care and handling of horses, training, and maintenance of equipment, or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.
  • Valid Driver's license in good standing.
  • Must have and maintain Illinois Mandated Reporter certification or obtain upon hire (training provided).
  • Must have and maintain CPR, AED, and First Aid Certification or obtain upon hire (training provided).
  • Knowledge of general equine care and handling methods, including behavior, anatomy, and the ability to recognize signs and symptoms of injury and illness.
  • Ability to ride with a balanced seat in Western and English tack.
  • Basic understadning of learning styles.
  • Understanding of occupational hazards and adherence to safe work practices.
  • Proficient in documenting observations in a thorough and objective manner.
  • Effective communication skills, both verbally and in writing.
  • Demonstrated ability to exercise sound judgment, especially in engaging with others and responding to animal behavior problems and emergency situations.
  • Capability to work in close proximity to potentially dangerous and unpredictable animals.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, allowing for courteous, respectful, and productive interaction with supervisors, fellow employees, volunteers, students, visitors, and participants.

 

Schedule: Works on an as-needed basis during certain peak seasons or programs for a variable number of hours per week and a variable number of weeks per year.

Pay: $23.83 - 26.04/hour.

Work Environment: This position requires working indoors and outdoors in all weather conditions. There is exposure to uneven terrain, working in pastures and barns, loud noise, dust, smoke, wildlife, domestic animals, and large animals.

Location: The Danada Equestrian Center in Wheaton, IL.

 

The Forest Preserve District of DuPage County is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace built on a foundation of respect, integrity, teamwork, and excellence. Our organization provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Title: Unique Riding Instructor Opportunity
Content:
Have you dreamed about becoming a riding instructor but weren't sure where to start? Or didn't think it was possible? Has your secret wish always been to teach riding, but it didn't seem like a real option? At Leg Up, the horse is the guide. We don't believe jumping higher or accumulating ribbons has any meaning if it's not accompanied by a purpose and a dream. Where do you want to go?

If you are looking for a life-changing career at a life-changing program, we might be the magic you have been waiting for. If you are passionate about teaching and eager for education, this program could lead to a career with us (both part and full time opportunities available). Job availability and when you are hired depends on your work ethic, mindset, and skills. If you qualify, you will join our family and become part of an exemplary approach that focuses on the art of teaching and coaching and which will give you skills not just in the ring and in the barn, but in life. Our program's emphasis is not only on hiring an instructor, it is primarily about working with special people who are looking for much more than just a job. This could be your chance for the dream job you didn't think was possible!

Leg Up Equestrian is seeking top candidates for our upcoming apprenticeship program beginning June 22'nd. Our apprenticeship program offers certification in our proven instructor course, as well as hands on skills in horse care, business training, and mounted lessons. This is in exchange for your hard work and commitment. Completion of the program could lead to a full or part time job at Leg Up. Visit us online at legupequestrian.com/instructor for more information and an application.

Leg Up is an English riding academy that emphasizes horsemanship and personal growth. We specialize in dressage, jumping, cross-country jumping, and eventing.

But what sets us apart? • A developed, proven curriculum (our “Levels of Achievement”) that has brought success to thousands of riders of all ages, interests, and abilities. • Our emphasis on a warm, positive environment and unique working student program that teaches character and personal growth as part of horsemanship. • Our safe schoolmaster horses, our certified instructors, and our integrated barn and horse care instruction. • But mostly, what makes Leg Up so special is that our top priority is to unite our students with the magic of horses so that they can realize their dreams, find their voice, and grow.

Qualifications: No prior teaching experience required. You must be a high school graduate and 18 years old, some college experience is a plus. References will be checked and verified. You must have received English riding lessons and have minimum riding competency. You must have a passion for horses and, like us, want to share this passion with others.

This could be your chance for the dream job you didn't think was possible!

Leg Up Equestrian is seeking top candidates for our upcoming apprenticeship program beginning June 22'nd. Our apprenticeship program offers certification in our proven instructor course, as well as hands on skills in horse care, business training, and mounted lessons. This is in exchange for your hard work and commitment. Completion of the program could lead to a full or part time job at Leg Up. Visit us online at legupequestrian.com/instructor for more information and an application.

Leg Up is an English riding academy that emphasizes horsemanship and personal growth. We specialize in dressage, jumping, cross-country jumping, and eventing.

But what sets us apart? • A developed, proven curriculum (our “Levels of Achievement”) that has brought success to thousands of riders of all ages, interests, and abilities. • Our emphasis on a warm, positive environment and unique working student program that teaches character and personal growth as part of horsemanship. • Our safe schoolmaster horses, our certified instructors, and our integrated barn and horse care instruction. • But mostly, what makes Leg Up so special is that our top priority is to unite our students with the magic of horses so that they can realize their dreams, find their voice, and grow.

Qualifications: No prior teaching experience required. You must be a high school graduate and 18 years old, some college experience is a plus. References will be checked and verified. You must have received English riding lessons and have minimum riding competency. You must have a passion for horses and, like us, want to share this passion with others.

Title: camp riding instructor
Content: Pine Trails Ranch in Davis Ca is looking for a riding instructor to help teach camp.  Camps vary in levels from beginners through advanced intermediate.  Each rider is taught to prepare their own horse, ride, and care for that horse.  Instructors must have good teaching skills in English and western basics.  Understanding of diagonals and leads, how to 2 point, and how to use correct leg cues for the horse.  Reins signals are all 2 handed, as we do not teach neck reining until advanced levels are reached.  Job is paid and can include housing.

Title: Bookkeeper
Content:
Job description includes timely processing of A/P and A/R in addition to overseeing payroll processing through an external company, disbursement of sales proceeds, month-end closings, Human Recourses, banking operations, vendor credit card management, ACA compliance, and weekly cash flow summary.  Candidate will also compile and provide data to an external CPA firm.

Strong computer skills including, but not limited to Horse Farm Management, Word, Excel and QuickBooks are important.

The ideal candidate should possess strong organizational and problem solving skills.  Proficiency in both written and verbal communication along with familiarity of the Thoroughbred industry while working well in a team environment and comfort in reporting directly to managing partners.

We offer a modern office facility and a welcoming work environment.  Salary will be commensurate with experience.  Health insurance is provided as well as standard vacation and sick days.

Title: Stable Hand
Content:
Dancing Horse Farm (DHF) is looking to fill a Stable Hand position.  The candidate must have a strong work ethic and is undeniably reliable.  The Stable Hand position is responsible for feeding horses, stall cleaning, cleaning and refilling water buckets, barn/pasture rotation, dressing/undressing horses, noticing injuries/lost shoes then notifying management; in general, maintaining the cleanliness of the barn, aisles, and facility and health and safety of the horses.  Experience with handling horses is a plus.

A full or part-time position is available.  Must be willing to work most weekends.

Applicant MUST have reliable transportation.

Contact Justin Huth @ 513-224-7408

Dancing Horse Farm is a 40+ sporthorse facility housing a premier dressage training center called ‘Team Dream Training Center’.  Located in Lebanon, Ohio, the DHF's facilities are unrivaled with the 1/2-mile track, the regulation dressage indoor arena with over 125 linear feet of mirrors and rolling grass infield for hill work, two outdoor arenas, round pen, tons of pasture turnout all with auto waterers and dry lots. Learn more at: www.mydhf.com or Jennifertruett.com

Title: Horseback Riding Instructor / Horse Trainer
Content:
We're looking for an experienced Riding Instructor / Horse Trainer to join our team!

New team member must meet the needs of students with a wide variety of riding experience, from lead-line lessons, to first-time youth riders from beginner through advanced jumping lessons (up to 2'6). We have a large clientele of youth / beginner riders, so instructors with limited jumping experience are also encouraged to apply.

Qualified instructors should have a minimum of 3 years of teaching experience and a sound knowledge of horse care. Instructors involved in or having completed college degree programs or certification programs (such as those offered by the BHS, USHJA, USDF, ARIA, CHA, etc.) are especially encouraged to apply.

We insist upon professionalism, punctuality, personal dedication to educating riders at all levels, and commitment to self-improvement. Applicant must be willing to work in a team-first environment. Applicant must be kind to the horses (and clients), friendly, and maintain a patient, professional attitude at all times.

Teach horseback riding lessons

Help with basic barn chores, duties and projects

Tack and untack horses

School lesson horses

Organize schooling shows

Friendly, upbeat, positive attitude

Organized, responsible, detailed, reliable and fun loving

Kind, accountable, trainable, coachable, open minded, and customer service oriented

Opportunity for 1 boarded horse

Job Type: Full-time

Supplemental pay types:

  • Quarterly Bonuses

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Work with HORSES!
  • 401(k)
  • Employee discount
  • Paid time off
  • Professional development assistance

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift

Education:

  • High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

  • Teaching Horseback Riding Lessons: 3 years (Required)
  • Working with Children: 4 years (Required)

License/Certification:

  • First Aid Certification (Preferred)
  • CPR Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

Title: Equine Facilities Team Member
Content:
Full Circle Farm a beautiful 160 acre farm, in Newport, NH, is seeking an Equine Facilities Team Member to work closely with our existing trainer.  Requirements for this position are 1-3 years of proven work experience working with and around horses safely.  FCF embraces the Natural Horsemanship philosophy and the Team Member must be willing to do the same.

Duties include assisting with morning and afternoon barn chores, cleaning stalls, paddocks, assisting with moving horses and hay, accurately distributing grain and supplements during feedings.

The successful candidate will be self-motivated, have strong listening skills, ability to follow directions, work independently and within a team environment. Physical demands include working outdoors in all weather conditions, ability to lift and move objects up to 50 pounds or more. Computer skills are a plus.

Valid driver’s license required. This is a full-time position, weekend availability with benefits including health insurance and paid time off.  Apartment for rent on premises is available.

Visit our website at www.fullcirclefarm-nh.com for more information about our exceptional facility. If you are passionate about working with horses and possess the necessary skills, we would love to hear from you. Interested applicants should submit a resume to hr@nfronline.com

Title: Equine PEMF Practitioner/Bodyworker
Content:
Position Title: Equine PEMF Practitioner Location: Hudson Valley of New York. Company: ProPulsion Equine PEMF, LLC Position Type: 1099 Independent Contractor Pay: $4,000-$5,400+/month

About Us:

We are hiring! As our practice continues to grow and expand, we are looking to add a fourth member to our team. ProPulsion Equine PEMF specializes in equine wellness therapies, providing pulsed electromagnetic field (PEMF) therapy, kinesiology taping (KT), and red light therapy (RLT). Based in the Hudson Valley of New York since 2020, we work with 220-270 horses each month, encompassing various disciplines but primarily focusing on hunter/jumper.

Position Overview:

In this highly rewarding role, you will be trained and certified to perform PEMF, KT, and RLT sessions with horses. We will provide extensive (paid) training, mentorship in a supportive learning environment, and a roster of established clients to ensure your success. As an independent contractor, you will have the flexibility to choose your own schedule and map your own client routes. Our clients are wonderful to work with, and we take pride in our work.

Ideal Candidate:

  • ●  Extensive experience in the equine industry with excellent horse-handling skills.
  • ●  Formal college education in equine science or a related field.
  • ●  Background in equine healthcare, bodywork, or rehabilitation.
  • ●  Strong knowledge of equine anatomy, physiology, biomechanics, health, andperformance.
  • ●  Passion for helping horses.
  • ●  Familiarity with the hunter/jumper industry.
  • ●  Self-driven with excellent time management and communication skills.
  • ●  Strong sense of professionalism.
  • ●  Dependable, trustworthy, and able to take initiative.
  • ●  A desire to work with both horses and people.
  • ●  Valid driver’s license, safe driving skills, and reliable transportation.
  • ●  Based in the Hudson Valley of New York and willing to commute to various horse farmsand show venues within an 85-mile radius.
  • ●  Able to carry 35 lbs, stand for extended periods, and work in various weather conditionsyear-round.Contract Details:

● ProPulsion Equine will provide the clientele and cover the cost of your education, training, certifications, equipment, and supplies. Marketing, bookkeeping, vendor fees, and equipment insurance are also covered by our practice.

○ PEMF machine and attachments are valued at > $20,000.

  • ●  Full-time flexible work schedule.
  • ●  As a contractor, you will earn 40% of all PEMF revenue you generate.
    • ○  Usually $40/session, with an average of 45 minutes spent working on each horse, excluding driving time.
    • ○  Time spent ‘working on horse’ includes scheduling appointment, performing session, disinfecting equipment, writing session report, and sending invoice.
  • ●  Once fully trained and certified, average caseload will be 100-135 sessions/month with an average monthly income of $4,000-$5,400+.
    • ○  Opportunities to earn up to $400/day for a full day of work (10 horses).
    • ○  Virtually unlimited income potential: you are welcome to add new clients to yourschedule and will be paid for any work performed.
  • ●  As an independent contractor, you will be responsible for your own transportation coststo various client appointments. A business car will be made available to you at no costmost of the year (April-December).
  • ●  Proof of liability insurance is required.
  • ●  Payment will be provided by your choice of check or bank transfer twice a month.How to Apply: If you are passionate about equine wellness and eager to grow with our team, please send your resume and a brief introduction to Lucile Vigouroux at propulsionequine@gmail.com.

Title: Groom/Barn Staff
Content: ISO / For Immediate Hire  - Experienced groom/barn staff person that has a passion for living on site and enjoys the lifestyle of caring for horses.  A typical day starts with feeding, supplements, turnouts, barn chores, stalls, cleaning buckets, maintaining pastures and a variety of projects.  We are looking for someone who is detailed oriented, follows directions, accepts constructive criticism, has a positive attitude and looking to be around for the long term.  No smoking, drugs or drinking.  The living quarters are individual private studio rooms for single staff members (no pets please).  All expenses are paid as part of the compensation in addition to a monthly salary.  Please provide contact information, work history and any references.  Must be ready and available within 1 week.

Title: Adaptive Riding Instructor/Assistance Barn Manager
Content:
Sundance Circle Hippotherapy is seeking a passionate and dedicated PATH Certified Therapeutic Riding Instructor or CHA Instructor of Riders with Disabilities (IRD) to join our team and help us expand our adaptive riding program. **Must be 18 years or older to apply!** We are currently seeking a part-time instructor for 30 hrs/week who is eager to grow into a full-time position and play a key role in developing a thriving adaptive riding program.

This position is a combination of Adaptive Riding Instructor and Assistant Barn Manager. The assistant barn manager is based at the facility and ensures the smooth running of the facility throughout patient session operating hours. Patient session operating hours are variable. During this time the assistant manager is the staff supervisor to all activities in the facility, with on-call support from the Barn Manager and/or Operations Manager as required. Saturday work may be required.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide therapeutic riding instruction for individuals with disabilities, following individualized treatment plans and PATH Intl./CHA guidelines.
  • Develop and implement engaging and effective lesson plans tailored to each rider's goals and abilities.
  • Collaborate with therapists, parents, and other stakeholders to ensure comprehensive care for each rider.
  • Maintain a safe and positive learning environment for both riders and horses.
  • Assist in the training and supervision of volunteers.
  • Participate in ongoing professional development opportunities to stay up-to-date on therapeutic riding practices.

Qualifications:

  • Current PATH Intl. Certified Therapeutic Riding Instructor (CTRI) certification or CHA Instructor of Riders with Disabilities. Current riding instructor working towards PATH/CHA certification welcome to apply.
  • Must be at least 18 years old to qualify for PATH CTRI or CHA IRD!!
  • Strong understanding of disabilities and their impact on riding skills.
  • Excellent horsemanship skills and experience in handling and working with horses. Minimum 2 years of relevant horse experience required.
  • Compassionate and patient demeanor with a commitment to helping individuals with disabilities achieve their goals.
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills to interact with riders, parents, therapists, and volunteers.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Compensation:

  • Starting pay of $16.28 per hour, with the potential for advancement based on experience and performance.
  • Part-time position (30 hrs/week) with the opportunity to transition to full-time status based on program needs and instructor performance.

Benefits:

  • Meaningful work in a supportive and collaborative environment.
  • Professional development opportunities to enhance skills and knowledge.
  • Opportunity to make a positive impact on the lives of individuals with disabilities.
