Title: Working Student/Fellowship
Content:
The Scattered Acres Fellowship is an experiential learning program focused on riding instruction and comprehensive professional development in the equine industry. We prefer our applicants have at least two years of riding and horse care experience and commit to a one-year fellowship but will consider shorter durations as well. Our curriculum and focus is calibrated for each individual depending on their experience, the duration of their commitment and their goals. All fellows are instructed in the fundamentals of equine care, barn management, riding instruction, horse training, competition grooming and equestrian business management. Intensive daily riding lessons from the founder and owner of Scattered Acres, Autumn Rae, will focus on elevating our fellows to be competent and competitive equestrians in dressage, stadium and cross country jumping. We are located in the geographic heart of eventing, dressage and hunter jumper country so there will be ample opportunities to attend and perhaps compete in local USEA, USDF, USHJA, competitions. Additional educational activities will include reading assignments, various clinics and working with our on-site non-profit HEAL which is an equine assisted learning and psychotherapy organization working to assist veterans and first responders. There is no shortage of opportunities to learn and advance here at Scattered Acres. Fellows are immediately immersed in the responsibilities of operating a busy riding stable and contribute to the efforts of our professional team. Our fellows benefit tremendously from this intensive practical experience and leave prepared for many possibilities in the equine industry. Please see our website for more information.
5 days per week working schedule. Length of commitment: 1 to 2 semesters preferred. Or 6-12 months as a working student. Fellows and working students have the opportunity to extend their stay if it is a good fit for long term employment. Must have a minimum of 10,000 recent hours of horse care and riding experience to be a good fit for the job.
Fellows share quarters with one other working student. The room is the size of a large dorm room, with an attached office and lounge with kitchen and bathroom. Utilities and living quarters are free of charge as part of the program. Fellows are welcome to bring a horse, though it is not necessary for program.
Scattered Acres is a beautiful 48-acre farm between Manassas and Warrenton, Virginia. We currently have 36 horses on our property, most of which are high performance competition horses. We have been in business for over 15 years and have built a reputation for extremely high quality training and coaching, impeccable management of our facility and excellent care for our horses. We take pride in providing a professional and peaceful atmosphere and offer a multitude of educational opportunities and services for our clients and fellows. We consider our stable community to be a family of impassioned riders who work together to accomplish whatever goals they hope to achieve.
Fellowship/working student benefits include: • 5 riding lessons per week • 10 hours barn management instruction per week • Free on-site lodging with all utilities included • Reading materials provided -and- • Monthly stipend of $450 upon proven proficiency -or- • Free field board for 1 horse upon proven proficiency • Free hauling to competitions and XC training
In addition to the monthly stipend, once fellows are able to teach lessons at Scattered Acres, they are paid for the lessons they give starting at $18/45 minutes. Lessons taught are in addition to normal working hours. The value of this fellowship (not including stipend and pay earned for giving lessons) is approximately $53,850 for one year stay.
Please email your resume, cover letter, and a riding video to scatteredacreseventing@gmail.com

Scattered Acres is a beautiful 48-acre farm between Manassas and Warrenton, Virginia. We currently have 36 horses on our property, most of which are high performance competition horses. We have been in business for over 15 years and have built a reputation for extremely high quality training and coaching, impeccable management of our facility and excellent care for our horses. We take pride in providing a professional and peaceful atmosphere and offer a multitude of educational opportunities and services for our clients and fellows. We consider our stable community to be a family of impassioned riders who work together to accomplish whatever goals they hope to achieve.
Fellowship/working student benefits include: • 5 riding lessons per week • 10 hours barn management instruction per week • Free on-site lodging with all utilities included • Reading materials provided -and- • Monthly stipend of $450 upon proven proficiency -or- • Free field board for 1 horse upon proven proficiency • Free hauling to competitions and XC training
In addition to the monthly stipend, once fellows are able to teach lessons at Scattered Acres, they are paid for the lessons they give starting at $18/45 minutes. Lessons taught are in addition to normal working hours. The value of this fellowship (not including stipend and pay earned for giving lessons) is approximately $53,850 for one year stay.
Please email your resume, cover letter, and a riding video to scatteredacreseventing@gmail.com

Title: Certified Bit Fitter
Content:
On The Bit Inc. Bit Fitter Certification Program is not merely offering a course but instead a complete business package for you to become a competent bit fitter and launch your successful practice.

This is not a position to work for On The Bit Inc.  You will be your own boss and make your own hours.

The program is approximately 4 - 6 weeks of online learning and then a 4 day practical in Bonfield, Ontario, Canada (Date TBA).  It will include not only the course but all the tools,  bits (for purchase at the practical) and support necessary to get your business off the ground.

Title: Equine Care Coordinator/Trainer
Content:
The Equine Care Coordinator works with other caretakers and supervisor to keep the rescue barn running smoothly, orders all supplies, holds for all appointments, keeps files and records for all horse care.

Additionally, this position requires the candidate to evaluate rescue horses for past training and capabilities and works with these horses to help them become more adoptable. Advanced riding and training experience is required. Candidate meets with potential adopters to help match them with appropriate horses, follows through with record keeping with adoptions.

The candidate should live within 45 minutes of Lima, NY, have drivers license, reliable transportation and cell phone. They should be willing to work as a team, communicate well, and have a strong desire and empathy in helping needy horses to a better future.

Begin Again Horse Rescue is a well established, award winning,non profit 501c3 organization looking for a like minded Equestrian to join our team.

Title: Executive Director
Content:
The Friesian Horse Association of North American (FHANA) is seeking an individual with strong interpersonal, communication, customer service, and teaming and problem solving skills. The candidate must be data and results-driven, demonstrate self-initiative, and possess the ability to anticipate challenges and opportunities in the Friesian equine industry both here in North America and in the Netherlands.

The Executive Director will perform his/her duties at the FHANA Office in Lexington Kentucky and will serve as the liaison between FHANA and the home of our Friesian horse registry, Koninklijke Vereniging 'Het Friesch Paarden-Stamboek (KFPS), in the Netherlands. The candidate will work closely with FHANA’s governing Board of Directors on organizational activities, functions, and events and committee chairs.

Duties/Responsibilities:

The Executive Director is the “face of FHANA” and he/she is key in organizational planning and communications, executing FHANA events such as Inspection and Annual General Meetings, and interactions with our stakeholders. The incumbent will manage an office staff which is comprised of two staff employees and a contractor. The operating budget of FHANA is approximately $700,000. The incumbent will be responsible for tracking expenditures and revenue, providing the Board of Directors with monthly financial recaps, developing annual budgets in collaboration with the Finance Committee and the Board of Directors, paying association bills, capturing and entering employees’ time for compensation, and the like. The individual will also be responsible for complying with human resources practices as specified by the Commonwealth of Kentucky Merit system and facilitating compliance with FHANA’s Bylaws and Rules and Regulations.

The candidate must possess effective oral and written communication skills to support a diverse membership that includes constituents from Canada and the United States. A subset of these are French and Spanish speaking members. However, the incumbent is not expected to speak French or Spanish; the organization is developing an infrastructure of mentors, volunteers, and has website translation to support all of our members’ informational needs.

The incumbent will be expected to present administrative information to constituents in both North America and to representatives from the KFPS in the Netherlands. These communications occur via the official website, virtual meetings, webinars, correspondence, and social media.

The individual shall demonstrate a commitment to FHANA’s mission statement: “To promote and preserve the KFPS Friesian Horse in North America,” and a commitment to organizational inclusion, civility, integrity, transparency, and accountability and compliance with the Code of Conduct, Bylaws, and Rules and Regulations.

Knowledge of the KFPS Friesian breed, disciplines, and the necessary infrastructure to offer annual Friesian inspections and shows is desired. The Executive Director shall promote FHANA as the preferred Friesian registry in North America. The candidate shall foster a culture of diversity, engagement, inclusion, and acceptance throughout the organization, including FHANA office staff and members.

 Vision

The vision includes but is not limited to FHANA being a leader in the equine industry relating to the promotion of the Friesian horse in North America, equine research, health, and wellness, registration of KFPS Friesian horses, fostering sound breeding practices, member education, fostering membership growth and diversity, and revenue generation and financial stewardship to ensure financial sustainability.

 Mission

To promote and preserve the KFPS Friesian Horse in North America

 Core Values

Health, safety, and welfare of the purebred KFPS Friesian horse

Ensure organizational financial viability and organizational growth

Exceptional customer service

A culture of civility, integrity, inclusion, and diversity

Salary

The salary will be commensurate with experience.

Please forward resumes and cover letters to Jo Clough, FHANA Treasurer at jclough@FHANA.com by July 22, 2024.

Title: Riding Instructor (English, Part-Time, with Weekend Hours)
Content:
We are searching for an outgoing, reliable instructor to join our staff!

Must be able to teach kids & adults, beginners through intermediate (WTC/18"-2’ jumping), private & group lessons (3-7 riders). We have nearly 200 regular clients.

Part-time: Primarily looking to hire for Saturdays 8:30am-3pm and a few weekday afternoons/evenings.

Full-time: Additional duties (e.g., barn chores, coaching at shows, camps, clinics) may be available for those who wish to work full-time.

Certifications are not a requirement. Attitude and teaching skills are most important!

Pay to reflect experience and skills demonstrated. Must pass a background check and have reliable transportation. Non-smoker highly preferred.

If interested, please email Karen at fullmoonfarmkaren@gmail.com.

Title: Farrier/Farrier Helper
Content:
We are looking to employ a new farrier and/or farrier helper to work in Carroll County, MD (and the surrounding area).

The ideal applicant has an interest in horseshoeing and either plans to go to farrier school, is in training, or has recently finished their training.

This is a primarily part-time opportunity (usually Mondays, Wednesdays, and/or Fridays), with the possibility of full-time employment at our lesson barn (chores, groundskeeping).

Looking to hire immediately. Pay to reflect experience and skills demonstrated.

Must pass a background check and have reliable transportation. Non-smoker highly preferred.

If interested, please call or text Stephen at (443) 375-7826.

Title: Donkey Rescue Groom/Caretaker
Content:
Little Longears Miniature Donkey Rescue is located at a brand new, 100 acre facility in New Oxford, PA.  We are looking for experienced grooms and caretakers for the more than 140 donkeys, mules and ponies in our care.  Duties will include general barn work, feeding, cleaning stalls, barns and paddocks, helping with the vet, farrier and dentist, turn out, grooming and handling of donkeys and light training activities.

We don't expect anyone to necessarily have much, or any donkey experience, but it is necessary that applicants have experience working with green or young horses.  Many of these donkeys and mules can be challenging, and this job is not for someone without significant experience.  We will train and teach applicants the specifics of working with these donkeys and mules, but a thoughtful, patient, and confident person is a must.

If you have been there and done that, and are looking for a break from the intensity of a show barn, this might be a great change of pace for you.  We are serious about taking exceptional care of all the residents at our rescue.

Salary is competitive, dependent on experience, and will be discussed individually.

Housing is offered as a part of compensation if needed.   A brand new construction, 4 bedroom home is available for shared housing.  Up to 3 employees (all women) will eventually share this house.  The house is located exactly 5 minutes from the farm.  Utilities are included.  Some pets may be considered on a case by case basis.

Donkeys have a strong aversion to dogs, so no dogs are allowed to accompany employees to the farm.  We do not have room for personally owned horses either.  No smoking, drinking, drugs or drama while at work.

Title: Equine Professional-Rider/Trainer
Content:
Proven Rider/Trainer: This is a Full Time, all encompassing position for the True Equine Professional.

This professional position includes Typical farm work, barn chores, Riding, Training, Giving lessons to clients, etc.

You must be a very good rider with proven abilities in the Equine Industry.

Experience in both Western and English riding is an added advantage.

You must have impeccable references and a proven record of accomplishments.

Please do not apply if you are not an experienced, proven good rider as this is a major requirement.

Send resume, qualifications and references:

Info@HollisRanch.com

Phone us @ 603-465-2672 for more information and an initial phone interview.

REQUIREMENTS

Excellent physical condition, ability to lift heavy loads and perform physical labor such as barn/farm chores, riding, training. You must be a very good rider. Having both Western and English riding abilities is an asset. Impeccable valid references are required as well as extensive background checks. You must be able to relocate if required to be able to live close to Hollis Ranch, L.L.C. Phone us @ 603-465-2672 for more info and an initial phone interview. Send your resume and riding videos to Info@hollisranch.com

Title: Barn Assistant/Groom
Content:
Core Equestrian in Woodside, CA is looking for a new full time or part time groom/barn assistant. We have a well-established program that caters to dressage and jumper riders. The job will include duties associated with the daily care and maintenance of approximately 25 sport horses. Duties will include proper care of all horses including feeding, turnout, grooming, tacking, blanketing, and other tasks for an efficient barn. No stall cleaning is required. Solid experience handling horses, eligibility to work in the US and able to speak English is required. Riding, showing and/or teaching may be an option if the candidate is qualified. We are looking for a combination of a team player and self-starter who is attentive to the needs of the horses and the barn even when not under direct supervision. We have an amazing group of people and horses, and we are looking for a new teammate who will thrive in a long-term position! Our program is outlined at http://www.coreequestrian.com.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Expected hours: No less than 15 per week

Title: Equestrian Trainer
Content:
Reports to: Director of Riding/Head Trainer
Status: Full time
Job Summary:
Supports the Head Trainer/Director of Riding in managing, planning, administration and supervision of
the equestrian programs for the School. Teach elements of horsemanship and horseback riding to
students. Schools/rides horses in order to exercise them for training purposes.
Equestrian Trainer
Scope of Responsibilities
Lesson and Riding Program:
- Manage the lesson schedule and teach daily lessons as per the schedule, plus additional extra
lessons for students.
- Responsible to help organize and maintain a schedule for the show horses and their training
schedule
- Support the planning and maintaining of a horse show schedule, both on and off campus
- Take students to one-day local shows, as well as multi day “A” shows
- Assist in the coordination of all necessary details for travel and participation for students and
horses at shows.
- Support design of Ground School curriculum
- Oversee all Barn operations in the absence of the barn manager.
- Assist in communication to parents
-Assist with The Ethel; Walker School Summer Riding Experience (EWS SRE)

-Assist with EWS IEA
- Responsible for assisting with evaluation, design and implementation of all systems, policies,
protocols within riding department (i.e. safety, billing, communications etc.)
- Supervise plan of care and training for class horses
- Other duties as assigned
Other:
1. Promote a student-centered approach to work priorities and encourage student
involvement in barn operations.
2. Support an environment devoted to education and ethics.
3. Exhibit a commitment to excellence in all work as evidenced by high standards of
cleanliness, service, workmanship and compassion for the horses.
4. Exhibit a commitment to honor as evidenced by honesty and integrity.
5. Exhibit a commitment to community through the caring and respectful treatment of all
members, through collaboration, and putting the interests of the group ahead of individual
interest.
6. Exhibit a commitment to diversity as evidenced by the respectful treatment of all
members of the community without regard to race, color, gender, sex, religion, sexual orientation
and national or ethnic origin.
All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply. The Ethel Walker School is an Equal Opportunity
Educational Institution/Equal Opportunity Employer that provides equal opportunity for all and does not
discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender
identity/gender expression, disability, religion, or veteran status.
To apply, please submit a resume, cover letter, contact list of three (3) professional references in one (1)
document to careers@my.ethelwalker.org.
For information on The Ethel Walker School please visit our website at www.ethelwalker.org

Title: Horseback Riding Instructor / Horse Trainer
Content:
We're looking for an experienced Riding Instructor to join our team!

New team member must meet the needs of students with a wide variety of riding experience, from lead-line lessons, to first-time youth riders from beginner through advanced jumping lessons (up to 2'6). We have a large clientele of youth / beginner riders, so instructors with limited jumping experience are also encouraged to apply.

Qualified instructors should have a minimum of 2 years of teaching experience and a sound knowledge of horse care. Instructors involved in or having completed college degree programs or certification programs (such as those offered by the BHS, USHJA, USDF, ARIA, CHA, etc.) are especially encouraged to apply.

We insist upon professionalism, punctuality, personal dedication to educating riders at all levels, and commitment to self-improvement. Applicant must be willing to work in a team-first environment. Applicant must be kind to the horses (and clients), friendly, and maintain a patient, professional attitude at all times.

Teach horseback riding lessons

Help with basic barn chores / duties, special events and projects

Tack and untack horses

School our amazing lesson horses

Organize schooling shows

Friendly, upbeat, positive attitude

Organized, responsible, detailed, reliable and fun loving

Kind, accountable, trainable, coachable, open minded, and customer service oriented

Opportunity for 1 boarded horse

Job Type: Full-time

Supplemental pay types:

  • Quarterly Bonuses

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Up to $48,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • Employee discount
  • Flexible schedule
  • Paid time off
  • Professional development assistance
  • Retirement plan
  • Tuition reimbursement

Experience:

  • Horses: 6 years (Required)

License/Certification:

  • First Aid Certification (Preferred)
  • CPR Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

New team member must meet the needs of students with a wide variety of riding experience, from lead-line lessons, to first-time youth riders from beginner through advanced jumping lessons (up to 2'6). We have a large clientele of youth / beginner riders, so instructors with limited jumping experience are also encouraged to apply. Qualified instructors should have a minimum of 2 years of teaching experience and a sound knowledge of horse care. Instructors involved in or having completed college degree programs or certification programs (such as those offered by the BHS, USHJA, USDF, ARIA, CHA, etc.) are especially encouraged to apply. We insist upon professionalism, punctuality, personal dedication to educating riders at all levels, and commitment to self-improvement. Applicant must be willing to work in a team-first environment. Applicant must be kind to the horses (and clients), friendly, and maintain a patient, professional attitude at all times. Teach horseback riding lessons Help with basic barn chores / duties, special events and projects Tack and untack horses School our amazing lesson horses Organize schooling shows Friendly, upbeat, positive attitude Organized, responsible, detailed, reliable and fun loving Kind, accountable, trainable, coachable, open minded, and customer service oriented Opportunity for 1 boarded horse Job Type: Full-time Supplemental pay types:
  • Quarterly Bonuses

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Up to $48,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • Employee discount
  • Flexible schedule
  • Paid time off
  • Professional development assistance
  • Retirement plan
  • Tuition reimbursement

Experience:

  • Horses: 6 years (Required)

License/Certification:

  • First Aid Certification (Preferred)
  • CPR Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

Title: Assistant Manager
Content: This is a small, primarily event barn located near New Orleans, LA.  The main responsibilities are riding, teaching and horse care. There are opportunities for growth and learning through lessons, clinics, showing and training.
job_details_job_description: This is a small, primarily event barn located near New Orleans, LA.  The main responsibilities are riding, teaching and horse care. There are opportunities for growth and learning through lessons, clinics, showing and training.

Title: Groom
Content:
Busy riding school looking for a groom to join our team.  Opportunities for growth. The ideal individual: loves horses; good attention to detail; diligent and dependable; excellent time management; positive attitude, enjoys working with kids and adults.

  • Days needed: Wednesday - Sunday, hours vary
  • Responsibilities include but are not limited to helping:
    • Get horses out of stalls and bringing to crossties
    • Teaching riders how to groom and tack/untack the horses
    • Cleaning tack
    • Keeping crossties and tack room clean and tidy

Title: Dressage groom and/or evening barn caretaker
Content:
Private professional Dressage training barn seeks a responsible experienced individual to assist trainer Ali Calkins with grooming, tacking, and cooling down training horses on Fridays and Saturdays.

Additionally, we need some evening feeding and turnout shifts covered for Friday-Sunday and Friday mornings if possible. These can be separate jobs or combined.

Title: Part-time Barn Help
Content:
ISO 2 barn employees-both part-time positions to start in August.

Weekday Position:
Monday-Friday barn help with a morning and evening shift. Morning shift is from 7-10am and evening shift would be from 3-6pm, there could be some flexibility within these hours.

Weekend Position:
Saturday/Sunday barn help-would include AM/PM chores. Hours the same as above.

Would be working with FEI trainer and USDF Gold medalist. Job would include general wellness check on all horses, assessing and managing basic equine medical care, feeding, picking stalls, turning horses in/out, tacking up, blanketing, holding for farrier, etc.
We are a fun group to work with and have a really wonderful relaxed barn environment!
Must be mature, hard working, detail oriented, organized, and a passion for horses! This is not a riding position, but lessons could be provided on your own horse.

Title: Ranch Hand
Content:
Do you enjoy working outside? Are you not afraid to get dirty? Do you like working around horses?

We are seeking a part-time Ranch Hand at a private ranch in Cashiers, NC.

Duties include feeding horses, mucking stalls, moving hay, detailed cleaning of the barn/ facilities, grooming horses, other duties as assigned. Must have a clean driving record, reliable transportation, ability to do physical work, lift up to 50 pounds, and work in all types of weather. This is not a riding position. Housing is not available. Must be reliable and dependable. Starting pay $16/hour.

  • Day shift

Title: Groom/farm hand
Content:
Looking for honest, mature man or couple to live on our gorgeous New Hampshire horse farm. Apartment and salary included. We are looking for someone who really wants to make this their home, not a short term stop over on the way to something better. This is a high-quality life and we want to share it with someone who has a lot of integrity and will treat it with the respect it deserves. Does not need to speak English Fluently, we can get by with a translator app

Five personal horses to care for, And beyond that, basic farm help: assist owners with landscaping, fence, repairs, etc. applicants who have experience with construction will definitely take priority as long as their horse experience is also

We have no room for horses, children, but will consider a pet on a case by case basis.

Title: Assistant Director
Content:
Rainbow Meadows Equine Rescue and Retirement, providing safe haven to horses, donkeys and mules for 19 years, is seeking an Assistant Director to join our administrative team.  Rainbow Meadows is located near Junction City, Kansas.

The ideal candidate will have no less than 10 years of horse handling/care/management experience.  Computer proficiency and excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, are required. Previous history of non-profit employment or volunteer service and fund-raising involvement is a plus.

This is a salaried, supervisory position.

Interested candidates must provide resume, including non-family references, via email to Rainbowmeadowsrescue@gmail.com

Www.rainbowmeadowsranch.com

Facebook.com/Rainbowmeadows

References required!

You will have the opportunity to Ride and some showing if interested.

Work 40-50 hours a week.   Work with some great professional horsemen and women.

Loads of opportunities for growth in this position.

If you are looking for a position with fewer hours, contact us. We may have part-time positions too.

Title: Barn Manager
Content: We are looking for someone who can oversee our barn with 9 horses.  This is a private facility and would require someone who is able to oversee veterinary and equine care, procure feed, bedding and other materials for the horses, keep the stables in good shape and take care of a number of other farm animals (goats).  The position would be full time, 5 days per week.  Pay is competitive, and the working environment pleasant.

Title: Training Assistant/Intern
Content: Looking for a training assistant/intern to take the lead role in starting the young horses under saddle & helping keep the show horses exercised as needed.  May on occasion involve stall cleaning duties, feeding, haying, etc.  We do not bronc out our youngsters, we teach ground work first, build confidence, then proceed to the saddle.  Most of our young horses go on to be sale prospects, so a good foundation is a must.  Looking for someone experience, but not unopposed to learning new training methods if needed.  Job is Mon-Sat.  No housing on site, but we are close enough to town where there is affordable housing available.  Prefer non-smoker.

Title: Licensed Veterinary Technician - Large Animal Nursing Care
Content:
Cornell University Equine and Nemo Farm Animal Hospital would like to share our environment of growth and opportunity with you.

Our licensed veterinary technicians enjoy a hospital environment where their superb skills are appreciated and utilized each day. Alongside a vibrant team of board-certified clinicians and veterinary students, you will contribute to a highly individualized and cultivated patient and client experience.

We are seeking a licensed veterinary technician with an interest in large animal medicine to join our valued Nursing Care Team to work evening and overnight hours during the week and weekend.  With dedication to weekend duties, compensation will include both shift and differential pay.

As part of this highly knowledgeable and adaptable group, you will have the opportunity to

  • Exercise an independent and self-motivated spirit.
  • Participate in a team-based approach to excellent patient care.
  • Triage emergencies plus initiate stabilization and treatments.
  • Manage nursing care of all patients, including those that are critically ill.
  • Always be challenged with our diverse caseload from horses and cows to sheep, goats, alpacas, llamas, pigs and sometimes reindeer and camels.
  • Contribute meaningfully to the education of veterinary students, interns and residents.
  • Perform diagnostic evaluations and medical procedures using state-of-the-art equipment and techniques: bloodwork, ultrasound, endoscopy, radiographs, critical care monitoring and more.

Are you ready for your large animal career to start? Cornell University Hospital for Animals is here to help you get there. 

Required Qualifications:

  • Associate degree in veterinary technology from an AVMA accredited institution, plus NYS Licensure or eligible to be licensed in New York Sate
  • 1-3 years of relevant experience or equivalent qualification
  • Experience in and/or demonstrated commitment to supporting diversity, equity, access, inclusion, and wellbeing.
  • Ability to cultivate and develop inclusive and equitable working relationships with students, faculty, staff, and community members.
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills.
  • Ability to learn the patient tracking software.
  • Must be able to work independently in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple tasks simultaneously while under pressure and paying close attention to details.
  • Candidate must have the ability to meet the physical demands of the position, which includes, but are not limited to, stressful situations, prolonged standing and kneeling, as well as lifting and restraining patients.

Preferred Qualifications:

1-2 years of experience as a licensed vet technician (preferably with farm animals, or other working experience with farm animals).

What We Offer:

Great benefits! Cornell receives national recognition, as an award-winning workplace for our health, wellbeing, sustainability, and diversity initiatives.

  • A career ladder focused on career development and specialty advancement, with financial and mentorship support at every step
  • 3 weeks of paid vacation
  • Generous shift pay if applicable
  • 13 additional holiday days with generous holiday pay if you work on those days
  • An award-winning employer provided benefits program
    • Comprehensive health care options
    • Access to wellness programs
    • Employee discounts with local and national retail brands
    • Generous retirement contributions
    • Impressive educational benefits include tuition-free Extramural Study and Employee Degree Program, Tuition Aid for external education, and Cornell Children's Tuition Assistance program
  • Follow this link for more information: https://hr.cornell.edu/understand-your-benefits

How to apply:

Navigate to Workday, complete your profile information, and make sure to attach your cover letter and resume, preferably as one document!

 

Veterinary Technician Appreciation Week 2023 https://www.youtube.com/shorts/pMfk7fr7UCY

2021 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rPale9-VRgE

 

We welcome questions!

Gabriel Gonzalez - gag95@cornell.edu

**No Visa Sponsorship or relocation available for this position**

Title: Licensed Veterinary Technician II - Theriogenology
Content:
Looking for a new opportunity to grow with Cornell University Hospital for Animals?

Our licensed veterinary technicians enjoy a modern hospital environment where their superb skills are appreciated and utilized each day. Alongside a vibrant team of board-certified clinicians and veterinary students, you will contribute to a highly individualized and cultivated patient and client experience.

We are seeking a licensed veterinary technician (LVT) to join our Reproductive Service.  This unique position provides opportunity to work with both companion and farm animals, including a developed equine breeding program.    This program services client-owned and Cornell-owned animal that you will follow from conception to neonatal care. This motivated individual will assist with clinical service, teaching, and reproductive laboratory analysis.   The position is for daytime Monday-Friday. 

 

As part of this highly knowledgeable and adaptable group, you will have the opportunity to

  • Exercise an independent and self-motivated spirit.
  • Enjoy working in a state-of-the art veterinary teaching hospital and a brand-new facility at the Equine Park (EP), a 165-acre horse farm with lush green pastures that are home to over 60 horses for teaching and research.
  • Participate in a team-based approach to excellent patient care.
  • Always be challenged with our diverse caseload of many different species.
  • Opportunities to assist in small animal reproductive procedures and care.
  • Contribute meaningfully to the education of veterinary students, interns, and residents.
  • Perform diagnostic evaluations and reproductive procedures using state-of-the-art equipment and techniques: breeding soundness evaluations, semen analysis, ultrasound, endoscopy, advanced reproductive techniques.

 

Required Qualifications:

  • Associate degree in veterinary technology from an AVMA accredited institution, plus NYS Licensure or eligible to be licensed required within 3 months of joining.
  • 1-2 years of experience as a licensed veterinary technician with either small or large animal.
  • Desire to further develop stallion handling skills.
  • Experience in and/or demonstrate commitment to supporting diversity, equity, access, inclusion, and wellbeing.
  • Ability to cultivate and develop inclusive and equitable working relationships with students, faculty, staff, and community members.
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills.
  • Ability to learn the patient tracking software.
  • Must be able to work independently in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple tasks simultaneously while under pressure and paying close attention to details.
  • Candidate must have the ability to meet the physical demands of the position, which includes, but are not limited to, stressful situations, prolonged standing and kneeling, as well as lifting and restraining patients.

 

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with equine and farm animals strongly desired, with stallion and foal handling a plus.

 

What We Offer:

Great benefits! Cornell receives national recognition, as an award-winning workplace for our health, wellbeing, sustainability, and diversity initiatives.

  • A career ladder focused on career development and specialty advancement, with financial and mentorship support at every step
  • 3 weeks of paid vacation
  • Generous shift pay if applicable
  • 13 additional holiday days with generous holiday pay if you work on those days
  • An award-winning employer provided benefits program
    • Comprehensive health care options
    • Access to wellness programs
    • Employee discounts with local and national retail brands
    • Generous retirement contributions
    • Impressive educational benefits include tuition-free Extramural Study and Employee Degree Program, Tuition Aid for external education, and Cornell Children's Tuition Assistance program
  • Follow this link for more information: https://hr.cornell.edu/summaries-benefits

 

We Welcome Questions!

Gabriel Gonzalez - gag95@cornell.edu

**No Visa Sponsorship available for this position**

Title: Large Animal/Equine Veterinary Technician
Content:
LSU Veterinary Teaching Hospital in Baton Rouge, Louisiana is seeking a full-time technician to join the large animal nursing team. Part-time positions are also available. Veterinary Technician credentials are preferred but not required. Notable experience with large animal/equine husbandry and restraint is a must.

The Large Animal Hospital operates 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.  Duties to include support for outpatient, inpatient, surgery, internal medicine, isolation, ICU, and emergency cases seen during and after business hours.

4-10s schedule, primarily non-traditional hours with shift diff compensation ($2-$3.50). Some holiday shifts (1.5x wage), and on-call requirements (compensated $2/hour). Wage is hourly starting at $16/hour and increases with experience with ample opportunity for overtime. LSU offers excellent benefits for full-time employees including 14 paid holidays, abundant annual and sick leave, continuing education opportunities, outstanding health insurance, and multiple retirement packages.

Full job description and application can be accessed via the link.
For any questions, please contact Amy Geeding ageeding@lsu.edu

Title: Beginner Riding Instructor
Content:
Noble Road Equestrian is adding to their team. Are you passionate about horses and love teaching? We have a exciting opportunity for you! We are looking for!

*Experience at teaching beginning to intermediate riders

*Competition experience

*A love for kids

*Upbeat, energetic personality

*Teaching a curriculum based program

 

Competitive pay, Ideal schedule, Part- time, Dressage, western and horsemanship disciplines. Beautiful facility

Title: Ranch Hand/Groom
Content: Ranch Hand feed clean waterers and remove manure twice a day and groom two ponies twice a week. Hours 9-10 a.m.and 5:00 to 6:00 pm 7 days a week.
job_details_job_description: Ranch Hand feed clean waterers and remove manure twice a day and groom two ponies twice a week. Hours 9-10 a.m.and 5:00 to 6:00 pm 7 days a week.

Title: Morning Barn Worker
Content:
We're looking for a consistent barn worker to come and do morning chores between the times of 9 am - 12 pm during the fall/winter months on Tuesday, Thursday and the weekend (AM or PM tbd). Our current worker will soon be leaving for college in the fall and will be unable to continue working after 8/15/2024. Currently we have 8 horses in our barn, but only 7 actively work. Morning work is a flat rate of $60 and is a part time job.

Morning work includes:

  • leading horses in and out to pasture
  • feeding breakfast, making dinner, tossing hay, and refilling water buckets
  • cleaning stalls

Interested applicants should NOT expect to ride, and we currently do not accept working in exchange for riding. Our horses are ridden by our instructors and selected staff only. Basic horse experience (leading and interacting with horses, barn safety, etc.) is encouraged but not required, and applicants should be able bodied and be able to lift and push heavy loads. We will assist and help teach whatever skills might be needed! For more information, please contact us at volunteer@mdtrc.org .

Title: Beginner Horse Trainer/Riding instructor
Content:
Location: Equipoint Equestrian, [Pilot Point, Texas]

About Us: Equipoint Equestrian is a leading English equestrian facility dedicated to fostering a love for horses and riding. We provide top-tier training, boarding, and care for our equine friends and a supportive, welcoming environment for our riders. We’re excited to expand our team and are looking for a passionate Beginner Horse Trainer to join us!

Job Description: As a Beginner Horse Trainer at Equipoint Equestrian, you’ll play a key role in nurturing the skills and confidence of our novice riders. You’ll provide instruction in foundational riding techniques and horse care, ensuring a positive and educational experience for our clients.

Responsibilities:

  • Teaching: Provide beginner riding lessons focusing on safety, basic riding skills, and horse handling.
  • Training: Work with beginner-level horses to maintain and improve their training.
  • Client Engagement: Foster a friendly, supportive environment for clients, ensuring they feel comfortable and motivated.
  • Horse Care: Assist with general horse care duties, including grooming, tacking, and stable management.
  • Safety: Maintain a safe learning environment for both riders and horses, adhering to all safety protocols.

Qualifications:

  • Experience: Prior experience in teaching beginner riders and handling horses.
  • Skills: Strong communication skills, patience, and a passion for teaching and working with horses.
  • Certification: Riding instructor certification or equivalent experience preferred.
  • Physical Ability: Ability to perform physically demanding tasks and handle horses of varying temperaments.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Pay: Based on experience and qualifications.
  • Professional Growth: Opportunities for further training and development within our facility.
  • Community: A welcoming, supportive environment where your passion for horses and teaching can thrive.

How to Apply: Interested candidates are invited to send their resume and a brief cover letter to Marge@equipointequestrian.com. For more information, contact Marge at (727) 277-0194.

Join us at Equipoint Equestrian and inspire the next generation of riders!

Title: Barn staff
Content: Therapeutic horseback riding facility based out of Concord, North Carolina is looking for the next equine staff. Job includes feeding, watering, cleaning horses daily. We have a herd of 18 that we use for our therapeutic riding program. Keeping up with our veterinarian with shots, meds, etc.. Grooming attacking our equines for therapy on Tuesday and Thursday nights and Wednesday mornings. Keeping our  equines exercised. We would love to find someone who could be cross trained also in office duties as well.

Title: Dressage Groom
Content: Looking for a motivated individual 21year old or older. You will be part of a team with your focus being on a select number of horses. Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to: daily grooming, show grooming, show trailer packing, sales horse prep, blanketing, wrapping, clipping, braiding, bathing, equine first aid, tacking and untacking, handling horses (vet, farrier, turnouts, hand walking, etc.) feeding, managing and cleaning tack and equipment, operating and maintaining equine therapy equipment and treatments. Riding opportunities and lessons available. Located in Ocala Florida with most shows being local. This is a live in position with and one dry stall if needed.

Title: Now hiring a full-time Therapeutic Riding Instructor (CTRI)
Content: Motivated full-time CTRI wanted at Windridge Therapeutic Equestrian Center (a PATH Int’l Premier Accredited Center) outside of Longview, TX. Looking for a CTRI who is passionate about people, teamwork, teaching, and caring for horses. Position involves adaptive/therapeutic riding instruction & support, horse care & training, volunteer supervision, feeding rotation, help with facility maintenance & other duties as needed at a beautiful 25+ ac. facility with pastures/trails/pond, sensory trail & covered arena. Job involves computer use, ability to lift 50+ lb consistently (feed), and includes PTO, paid holidays, PATH Int’l membership, CTRI cont. ed. & renewal, & CPR/first aid certification. Salary commensurate with experience. High potential for barn/equine manager position, as well as individuals not yet certified, for the right candidate. Come join our awesome team!

Title: H/J instructor - Trainer
Content:
Bradshaw Equestrian Center in Mooresville, NC is looking for a professional Barn Manager/Trainer/Instructor for our 50 stall barn.

Must have background in hunter/jumpers and equitation. A competition record up to 1.3m is preferred.

References, valid driver license, background screen, and drug screen are required.

Salary and a stall plus benefits and housing will be provided for the right candidate. Health insurance, 401k, and paid vacation. Commissions for certain transactions.

Duties will include teaching lessons, schooling horses as needed, assistance with marketing sale prospects, monitoring health of all animals on property including horses, cats, and chickens, assistance with maintaining adequate stock of hay and grain, shavings, medications, and general supplies used by the facility. Professional and comprehensive communication with clients will be required. Assistance with all barn chores as needed as well as help with hiring, training, and managing farm staff.

Ability to pull a trailer is a plus. Operation of some farm equipment will be required but we are willing to teach.

Some travel will be required for showing, project trials, etc.

Title: Riding Instructor
Content:
Willow Mist Farm is excited to expand our team and are looking for a passionate riding instructor to join our growing lesson barn, located in Poolesville, MD, 30 min from DC. We are dedicated to fostering a love for horses and riding, providing top-tier care for our equine friends and a supportive, welcoming environment for our riders.

We have a small, boutique barn with an average of 15 lesson horses and a program that provides private, semi-private, and group lessons to children and adults of all ages, mostly beginner and advanced beginner riders.  Our current instructors come from varied backgrounds (English, Western, Hunt Seat, Dressage) and our goal is to help students excel with their horsemanship and embrace a passion in horses through mounted and unmounted instruction. We also offer trail rides to our students on the Montgomery County Epic Trails, which are connected to our farm in the Agriculture Reserve.

It is important that our employees are happy and enjoy what they do. We will work around your available hours, but weekend help is preferred.

Responsibilities:

  • Teaching: Provide beginner to intermediate riding lessons focusing on safety, basic riding skills, and horse handling.
  • Client Engagement: Foster a friendly, supportive environment for clients, ensuring they feel comfortable and motivated.
  • Horse Care: Assist with general horse care duties, including grooming, tacking, and stable management (cleaning up after lessons, tidying/picking stalls from your horses, and blowing the barn isle)
  • Safety: Maintain a safe learning environment for both riders and horses, adhering to all safety protocols.
  • Option for Training: Work with beginner-level horses to maintain and improve their training.
  • Regular communication: with the barn manager and owner to continue the facility’s excellent reputation, to maintain the facility/program, and to help us grow.

Qualifications:

  • Experience:  History of teaching horseback riding to children and adults is required, along with experience with handling horses.
  • Skills: Strong communication skills, patience, and a passion for teaching and working with horses.
  • Physical Ability: Ability to perform physically demanding tasks and handle horses of varying temperaments.
  • Non-smoker while on the property
  • Background check
  • References from past employers or industry professionals and references
  • Open communication is a must!

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Pay: Based on experience and qualifications.
  • Community: A welcoming, supportive environment where your passion for horses and teaching can thrive. Minimal boarders
  • Beautiful Farm: peaceful, quiet, very well-maintained
  • Opportunity for one boarded horse

How to Apply:

Interested candidates are invited to fill out the google form or send their resume and a brief cover letter to Andrea at info@willowmistriding.com.

Title: Executive Director
Content:
This 501 (c)(3) GFAS Accrwdited Horse and Donkey Sanctuary  seeks mature, experienced equine caretaker.

Duties include: feeding, preparing feed, cleaning stalls and pastures, minor wound care, turn in and turn out, maintaining  cleanliness of water buckets, troughs, wash racks, light grooming, etc.

We are not a “traditional” equestrian establishment. This job requires an open mind to a new and different paradigm in equine care. We look to encourage cognitively in the equines, reduce reactivity and look for experiences, not results.

Applicant must be a Florida resident. Days and hours: Friday 9:30-3:30 Saturday 7:30-11:30; Sunday 7:30-3:30; Monday 9:30-3:30

Title: Equine Manager
Content:
H.M.M. Therapeutic/Adaptive Horsemanship is a therapeutic riding program. We are small and growing.

We are looking for a person to help condition and exercise our program horses several times a week between sessions. That person would also be responsible for keeping track of all horse records of activities.

Would prefer a person with experience, but not necessary for the position, as we would train the right person.

We want a person who is an independent thinker and a 'team' player. someone who is wanting a long-term position. This position is part-time and could lead to a full-time position and opportunity for a person to becoming a Therapeutic riding instructor.

Title: Equine and Farm Animal Care Manager
Content:
Primary Responsibilities:

Reporting to the Senior Veterinary Hospital Director, the Equine and Farm Animal Care Manager is responsible the operations of our Farm and Equine Animal Department, which consists of daily care, rehabilitation, medical monitoring, training, and ultimately adoptions of various farm animals in our care.

 

Essential Functions of the Position:

  • Responsible for all essential functions of the Farm and Equine Animal Department.
  • Hire, train and schedule employees to meet shelter needs.
  • Instruct, train, and assist staff with their duties, use of equipment, and materials in assigned areas.
  • Assist in overseeing daily shelter operations, including, but no limited to adoptions, admissions, call center and the general care of animals.
  • Quality control of all procedures and areas. Keep all areas clean and safe.
  • Follow all safety protocols for department, staff, and volunteers.
  • Available to answers questions from staff and correct any policy and/or procedure violations.
  • Report observed health or behavior issues to the appropriate individual for treatment.
  • Assist staff with initial customer questions and/or issues in a timely manner.
  • Responsible for managing accurate information regarding customers and animals into the database.
  • Update Senior Veterinary Hospital Director on areas of interest and/or concern.
  • Provide information to the public about Houston SPCA programs and promoting good animal care and responsible pet ownership.
  • Advise potential adopters of Houston SPCA adoption benefits, policies, and procedures.
  • Protect all confidential information, including customers, donors, animals, animal investigative cases, employees, and internal communications.
  • Represent Houston SPCA by providing excellent customer service and focus.
  • Perform additional tasks as assigned.

 

Knowledge, Skill, and Abilities Needed to Perform the Essential Functions of this Position:

  • College degree in Animal, Agriculture, or similar area. Five to ten years of equine/shelter experience, including previous team management experience.
  • Working knowledge of breeds, diseases, medical conditions, and animal handling and behavior for horses and other farm animals.
  • Able to safely train and ride horses. Working knowledge of tacks and related equipment.
  • Ability to manage animals safely, with patience and gentleness.
  • Follow the mission of the Houston SPCA. Positive customer and public relations skills.
  • Thorough knowledge of Houston SPCA adoption policies and procedures.
  • Knowledge of Houston SPCA partners and products/services they offer.
  • Knowledge of the Houston SPCA policies and protocols, such as, but not limited to admitting, cleaning and medical protocols.
  • Ability to represent the Houston SPCA in a professional manner in all situations with the public, volunteers, and staff.
  • Ability to create and sustain positive working relationships within Houston SPCA, including with staff, other departments, volunteers, and the public. Strong collaborator.
  • Must be patient, courteous and work well under stressful conditions.
  • Knowledge and ability to accurately work with detailed information in paper and electronic form.
  • Ability to read, write and communicate effectively.
  • Ability to learn and quickly adapt to changes in programs and procedures.
  • Valid Texas Driver’s License with a safe driving record is required.
  • Ability to safely maneuver and drive a truck with horse trailer.
  • Ability to work unscheduled and flexible hours, including weekends, after hours, and during storm/disaster responses.
  • Ability to lift 50 lbs. Ability to work in various weather conditions and around various animals.

Title: Horse care position located north of Richmond VA
Content: Seeking either morning or afternoon horse care help, or combination of the two for a total 1f 8-20 hours per week for 10 horses, most who live out. Typical day can be 2.5 - 5 hours depending on candidate's needs. Historic farm, peaceful setting with large trees, modern facilities, professionally managed. Feeding, watering, cleaning 1-3 stalls/run in sheds, some blanketing,  grooming, and keeping stable tidy. Farm management, mowing, etc for higher number of hours. Prefer someone with young horse experience as we have a yearling and a 2 year old warmbloods coming along. Possible availability of up to 3 stalls for right person to bring own horses or training horses. Facility has 70x200  indoor with GGT footing, owned by retired USEF dressage judge and FEI rider with extensive training with a German riding master. Now pursuing incorporation of positive reinforcement training into dressage. Instruction available.

Title: HEAD FEI GROOM POSITION
Content:
We’re Hiring

Located in Fairfield, California

Looking for someone who:

  • has 3+ years working in a show barn.
  • knows how to do basic first aid.
  • can braid, wrap bandages, & clip.
  • self-starter, dependable, positive attitude & a team player.
  • confident handling hot and expensive horses.
  • willing to travel to shows & out of state. Sometimes we spend a few months out of the year training in another state.
  • has their own form of transportation.

Job includes:

  • Grooming, tacking, & caring for 10 dressage horses
  • Mon -Fri from 6am -4pm & some weekends for shows and clinics.
  • Pay based on experience.
  • Paid PTO & health/dental benefits.

Title: Assistant Trainer/Barn Help/ Junior Coach
Content:
Looking for help at an All-Around Show Barn!!

Looking for a motivated, physically able, horse-person that wants to learn to ride and train horses at high-level. Candidates should have knowledge and ability to safely be around horses, clean a stall, and manage a feed schedule. Primary duties would be horse management, exercising horses, lunging, teaching and tuning showmanship, and coaching beginner lessons. Happy to train the right individual to become a proficient and skilled rider, but candidates must have basic skills. If you are not sure you want to be in this industry this position is not for you!

5 days a week, 8 hours a day
Pay starts at $2000/month plus housing (for the right candidate)
Health Insurance after 6 months
Location: Preston, WA

Send PM with a phone number and details of your current experience in this field to be considered.

Title: Assistant Manager/Groom
Content:
Assistant Barn Manager position available at a busy dressage/eventing facility in North Salem, NY. 

We have 20+ horses on property, most of which are currently in training with a wide range of goals. Between dressage shows and horse trials we tend to be away 2-3 weekends/month during the summer and we need someone we can leave to run the farm on those occasions.

Daily tasks will include: managing staff and delegating tasks for the day, stalls, turn-in/out, making grain, inventory of supplements and medications, assisting with vet and farrier, tack ups, and occasionally grooming at shows. You will be working under the manager/dressage trainer but you will be the eyes in the barn and responsible for making sure everything runs smoothly throughout the day.

This is a live in position and there is a one bedroom private apartment above the barn available. We unfortunately are not able to accommodate a horse at this time. Ideally we would like someone to start ASAP and all potential applicants need to be able to come in for an interview.

Title: Weekend Stable Hand
Content:
Caney Fork Equestrian Center is seeking a part time (16+ hours/week) weekend stable hand. Weekends include Saturdays + Sundays.

Caney Fork EQC is a low volume, privately owned, high end facility committed to the exceptional care of each of the 8 horses on the property. We are seeking a responsible and dependable individual with a similar love and commitment to providing the best possible care to the horses.

Ideally this is is someone with a strong working knowledge of horses, their care and how to handle them. However we are happy to train someone with less experience if they fit our other criteria. Job duties include (but are not limited to):

Feeding, preparing grain + supplements, turning out + catching, blanketing + unblanketing, grooming horses, tack cleaning, horse laundry, stall cleaning, picking pastures + turnouts, general + deep barn cleaning, and maintenance of the arenas.

At this time we are just seeking a part time worker to cover Saturdays + Sundays. We are open to someone interested in working just one day each weekend, or the entire weekend every other week. There is the potential for more hours in the future/potential for a full time position to open up.

Starting pay is $18/hour for a 90 day probationary period followed by a raise based on performance.

Title: Licensed Veterinary Technician (LVT I) - Equine Performance
Content:
The Cornell University College of Veterinary Medicine seeks a Licensed Veterinary Technician to join the Clinical Sciences department in support of the Equine Performance Clinic. The mission of the Equine Performance Clinic is to provide clinical service to equine patients and to perform research into problems affecting the horse as an athlete.  Horses from throughout the northeastern United States are referred to this facility for evaluation and diagnosis of performance limiting disorders. The treadmill facility, as the focus for exercise related research, has enabled both basic and clinical scientists to contribute to the understanding of exercise physiology and the equine athlete.

 

The job responsibilities include, but are not limited to: 

  • Scheduling and record-keeping of treadmill use and maintenance, provide instruction to users to ensure safe treadmill operation.
  • Coordinate and order laboratory supplies, order and maintain equipment and supplies.
  • Daily care of experimental animals including bandaging, physical examination, and administration of drugs (excluding feeding and cleaning stall).
  • Conditioning of experimental animals for exercising on the treadmill.
  • Provide high level technical support to faculty engaged in a variety of large animal teaching and research activities, including endoscopy, inserting jugular and arterial catheters
  • Coordinate the large animal surgery and medicine courses, including budget management and scheduling

 

Employees working with animals must receive the pre-exposure rabies prophylaxis vaccination series prior to or immediately after hire, which will be paid for by the department.

 

Required Qualifications

  • Associate’s degree in Veterinary Technology with up to one year of relevant experience or equivalent combination of education and/or experience.
  • NYS Licensure or eligibility to be licensed
  • Proficient in equine handling.
  • Possess the technical knowledge and skills necessary to work independently, troubleshoot problems, and manage the lab.
  • Excellent organization, attention to detail and meticulous lab technique and data entry are required.
  • Computer proficiency and strong communication skills.
  • Experience in and/or demonstrated commitment to supporting diversity, equity, access, inclusion, and wellbeing.

 

Important Details about the Position

  • This is an onsite position located in Ithaca, NY.
  • This is a full-time two-year term position with potential for extension contingent upon funding and performance.
  • We are unable to provide Visa sponsorship, now or in the future, for this position.
  • Relocation assistance will not be provided for this position.

 

While the regular business hours are 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, the specific schedule may change to meet the needs of the business, requiring employees to work early mornings, evenings, weekends and University holidays and scheduled breaks.

 

The Following Documents are Required to be Submitted with your Application

  • Resume
  • Cover Letter

 

What We Offer:

Great benefits! Cornell receives national recognition, as an award-winning workplace for our health, wellbeing, sustainability, and diversity initiatives.

  • 3 weeks of paid vacation
  • 13 additional holiday days with generous holiday pay if you work on those days
  • An award-winning employer provided benefits program
    • Comprehensive health care options
    • Access to wellness programs
    • Employee discounts with local and national retail brands
    • Generous retirement contributions
    • Impressive educational benefits include tuition-free Extramural Study and Employee Degree Program, Tuition Aid for external education, and Cornell Children's Tuition Assistance program
  • Follow this link for more information: https://hr.cornell.edu/understand-your-benefits

 

Employees are expected to meet all of the Cornell University Staff Skills for Success, which are essential for individual and organizational success. 

 

Who We Are: 

The Department of Clinical Sciences endeavors to balance its three-fold missions of teaching, service and research. The department is dedicated to excellence in teaching, providing substantial effort towards clinical training of DVM professional students, interns and residents in the Cornell University Hospital for Animals, and values both clinical and basic research.

 

Questions?

Gabriel Gonzalez - gag95@cornell.edu

Title: Director of Equestrian Teams
Content:
Wilson College has an immediate opening for a full-time, Director of Equestrian Teams that will provide overall excellence in leading the development of two competitive varsity riding programs, including serving as the Head Coach for Western Team, with oversight of Hunt Seat.

The Director of Equestrian Teams, reporting to the Director of Athletics, is responsible for all aspects of a successful program, including compliance with College, IHSA and other applicable, intercollegiate rules and regulations. Duties include but are not limited to recruiting and mentoring academically and athletically talented student-athletes, implementation of successful strategies for program growth and competitiveness, fiscal management, supervising the Hunt Seat Coach and other administrative duties as assigned.

Bachelor’s degree required and demonstrated successful collegiate Western coaching, recruiting, and riding experience. Valid driver’s license, and background check clearance required.

Please submit one document that includes a letter of application, resume and names and contact information of three professional references. Application materials are accepted through the online system only. Review of materials begins immediately and will continue until the position is filled.

Title: Hunter-Jumper Instructor
Content:
General Description:

William Woods University is accepting applications for a full-time, tenure-track faculty position to teach equestrian studies as the Hunter/Jumper Instructor for the College of Equestrian Studies. The Hunter/Jumper faculty is responsible for teaching applied riding courses, applied theory courses, and other equine and equestrian courses . This position supervises the management and care of all horses used in the hunter/jumper string. The individual holding this position will also have the responsibility of coaching William Woods’ riders at local, regional, and national competitions.

The contracted teaching load is 12 hours per semester, with the opportunity to teach summer classes and intercession courses. Full-time faculty are expected to participate in faculty and campus committees, attend faculty assembly and college meetings, and conduct program and class assessments in accordance with standards developed by the University and outside accrediting entities. Faculty are also expected to develop educational programs to be presented to the campus at large as part of the University LEAD program and to attend such programs sponsored by other faculty in the university. Rank and salary are commensurate with qualifications and experience.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  •       Teach hunter/jumper riding courses to William Woods University students

o   Must be capable of teaching group lessons

o   Able to coach and assist WWU students at horse shows

  •       Supervise and manage horses, tack, horse care, and related facilities
  •       Serve as the faculty sponsor of the Hunter/Jumper Club (student organization)
  •       Teach various horse related courses to William Woods University students including teaching and managing horses
  •       Maintain the integrity of the hunter/jumper program at William Woods in the following ways:

o   Assist with the leases of horses over the summer and winter breaks

o   Assess the suitability of horse donations and work with donors to secure horses that will strengthen the hunter/jumper string

o   Demonstrate strong industry and alumni relations for future donations

o   Maintain a high visibility profile within the local and national community

  •       Demonstrate and cultivate strong relationships with industry stakeholders to assist with job and internship placement for students.
  •       Assist students with academic advising.
  •       Prepare course syllabi for assigned courses that meet the needs of students and accreditation requirements.
  •       Participate in the development of assessments and evaluation of courses and the program for continuing improvement.
  •       Maintain professional development according to personal and professional need.
  •       Assist in recruitment efforts for the program by participating in university recruitment events and communicating with interested students.
  •       Other duties as assigned.

Position Requirements:

  •       Master's degree required.
  •       Professional experience in the equine industry.
  •       Ability to perform teaching, administrative, and clerical duties independently in order to fulfill goals and objectives of the program within the overall mission of the College of Equestrian Studies, the School of Arts & Sciences, and the University.
  •       Teaching experience at a higher education institution is preferred.
  •       Demonstrated commitment to professional development, strong work ethic, and a commitment to working well with others.
  •       Knowledge of and demonstrated experience with integrating instructional technology into classroom experiences.
  •       Show coaching and training experience at the rated level
  •       Experience and ability to drive a truck and horse trailer
  •       Class E driver’s license or higher or intention to obtain this licensure.

Work Schedule:

This is a 9-month full-time position beginning January 2025. This position will be open until filled.
