Title: US - SALES REPRESENTATIVE & CUSTOMER SUCCESS MANAGER
Content:
ABOUT ARIONEO

At Arioneo, our mission is to revolutionize the health and performance of athletic horses by developing cutting-edge technologies that precisely measure their physical and physiological parameters. We collaborate with over 700 trainers and veterinarians worldwide, including more than 100 in the U.S.

Our solutions include:

  • EQUIMETRE: A unique sensor that measures speed, locomotion, and heart rate, combined with a personalized data analysis service.
  • EQUISYM: A solution dedicated to quantifying and analyzing equine locomotion to assist in veterinary diagnosis.

Since 2014, we’ve led the field in equine technology and science not just participating in the equine industry but actively shaping its future. Our solutions help trainers “complement their experience with data”, where even a 1% improvement can make the difference between winning and losing.

Arioneo is expanding, and we’re looking for passionate talent to strengthen our field team in the U.S., specifically in Florida or Kentucky.

ABOUT THE ROLE

We’re looking for someone passionate about horse racing, sales, and customer relations to join us as a Sales Representative & Customer Success Manager. In this role, you’ll support Arioneo’s growing U.S. market by prospecting new clients and managing relationships with racehorse trainers, veterinarians, and equine health professionals.

You’ll be responsible for the entire sales process, from building your own client portfolio to supporting customers with data analysis and after-sales service. You will also collaborate closely with our marketing, sales, and tech teams.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Prospecting: Identify and engage new prospects through dynamic, hands-on demonstrations of our sensors, with a focus on EQUIMETRE.
  • Business Development: Drive client acquisition in the U.S. and maintain long-term relationships with existing clients.
  • Events: Represent Arioneo at major horse racing events to grow your network and strengthen the brand’s visibility.
  • Customer Support: Provide fast, effective technical and logistical support to ensure client satisfaction and retention.
  • Client Success Management: Follow up with clients post-sale to ensure they get the most value from our products, assisting them with data analysis and training reports.

WHAT YOU’LL NEED: 

  • Strong knowledge of the horse racing industry; existing contacts within the U.S. racing sector, particularly in Florida or Kentucky, are a major advantage.
  • 1-3 years of experience in sales or business development.
  • Fluency in English; proficiency in Spanish is a plus.
  • A natural curiosity for new technology and a passion for science in equine sports.
  • Ability to work autonomously, managing your own schedule effectively while maintaining regular updates in our CRM system.
  • Willingness to travel frequently for on-site demonstrations and events.
  • A proactive and outgoing attitude, with a drive to reach out to prospects and meet your goals.

WHY JOIN ARIONEO?

  • Work Environment: Be part of a passionate and innovative team that’s deeply engaged in the world of horse racing.
  • Career Growth: Join a fast-evolving company with opportunities for personal and
    professional development.
  • Impact: Your work will directly contribute to improving racehorse performance and health through advanced technology solutions.

To help shape the future of equine performance, we need the best talent. If you think you can contribute to an exciting, challenging, and fulfilling environment at Arioneo, we invite you to apply.

APPLY

Interested candidates should submit their curriculum vitae, together with a letter of motivation, to recrutement@arioneo.com.
job_details_job_title: US - SALES REPRESENTATIVE & CUSTOMER SUCCESS MANAGER
job_details_job_description:
ABOUT ARIONEO
At Arioneo, our mission is to revolutionize the health and performance of athletic horses by developing cutting-edge technologies that precisely measure their physical and physiological parameters. We collaborate with over 700 trainers and veterinarians worldwide, including more than 100 in the U.S. Our solutions include:
  • EQUIMETRE: A unique sensor that measures speed, locomotion, and heart rate, combined with a personalized data analysis service.
  • EQUISYM: A solution dedicated to quantifying and analyzing equine locomotion to assist in veterinary diagnosis.
Since 2014, we’ve led the field in equine technology and science not just participating in the equine industry but actively shaping its future. Our solutions help trainers “complement their experience with data”, where even a 1% improvement can make the difference between winning and losing. Arioneo is expanding, and we’re looking for passionate talent to strengthen our field team in the U.S., specifically in Florida or Kentucky.
ABOUT THE ROLE
We’re looking for someone passionate about horse racing, sales, and customer relations to join us as a Sales Representative & Customer Success Manager. In this role, you’ll support Arioneo’s growing U.S. market by prospecting new clients and managing relationships with racehorse trainers, veterinarians, and equine health professionals. You’ll be responsible for the entire sales process, from building your own client portfolio to supporting customers with data analysis and after-sales service. You will also collaborate closely with our marketing, sales, and tech teams.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Prospecting: Identify and engage new prospects through dynamic, hands-on demonstrations of our sensors, with a focus on EQUIMETRE.
  • Business Development: Drive client acquisition in the U.S. and maintain long-term relationships with existing clients.
  • Events: Represent Arioneo at major horse racing events to grow your network and strengthen the brand’s visibility.
  • Customer Support: Provide fast, effective technical and logistical support to ensure client satisfaction and retention.
  • Client Success Management: Follow up with clients post-sale to ensure they get the most value from our products, assisting them with data analysis and training reports.
WHAT YOU’LL NEED: 
  • Strong knowledge of the horse racing industry; existing contacts within the U.S. racing sector, particularly in Florida or Kentucky, are a major advantage.
  • 1-3 years of experience in sales or business development.
  • Fluency in English; proficiency in Spanish is a plus.
  • A natural curiosity for new technology and a passion for science in equine sports.
  • Ability to work autonomously, managing your own schedule effectively while maintaining regular updates in our CRM system.
  • Willingness to travel frequently for on-site demonstrations and events.
  • A proactive and outgoing attitude, with a drive to reach out to prospects and meet your goals.
WHY JOIN ARIONEO?
  • Work Environment: Be part of a passionate and innovative team that’s deeply engaged in the world of horse racing.
  • Career Growth: Join a fast-evolving company with opportunities for personal and
    professional development.
  • Impact: Your work will directly contribute to improving racehorse performance and health through advanced technology solutions.
To help shape the future of equine performance, we need the best talent. If you think you can contribute to an exciting, challenging, and fulfilling environment at Arioneo, we invite you to apply.
APPLY
Interested candidates should submit their curriculum vitae, together with a letter of motivation, to recrutement@arioneo.com.

Title: Social Media Manager - Part Time / Flexible
Content:
We are a 78-year-old brand specializing in performance eyewear
tailored for the equestrian market. Our mission is to provide high-quality, stylish, and
functional eyewear to horse lovers who demand the best in both performance and fashion.

Position Overview:

We are seeking a passionate horse lover who is social media savvy to join our team as a
Social Media Manager. This is a part-time, remote position with flexible hours, perfect for
someone who is excited about the equestrian lifestyle and has an eye for engaging content.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Social Media Strategy Development:
○ Collaborate with key executives to develop and implement a social media
the strategy that aligns with our brand’s goals and values.
○ Identify and target key demographics within the equestrian community to
grow our social media presence.

2. Content Creation & Curation:
○ Curate and manage daily content (images, video, and written) that resonates
with our audience on Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok.
○ Showcase our products in an authentic and engaging manner, highlighting
their benefits and use cases in the equestrian world.
○ Keep up with the latest social media trends, particularly within the equestrian
community, to ensure our content remains relevant and appealing.

3. Community Engagement:
○ Actively engage with our audience by responding to comments, messages,
and mentions in a timely and professional manner.
○ Foster a strong community by encouraging conversations and interactions
that build brand loyalty and trust.
○ Identify and collaborate with influencers and brand ambassadors within the
equestrian community to enhance brand visibility.

4. Analytics & Reporting:
○ Monitor and analyze the performance of social media campaigns using tools
like Facebook Insights, Instagram Analytics, and TikTok Analytics.

○ Provide regular reports on social media metrics (e.g., follower growth,
engagement rates, reach) and adjust strategies as needed to meet growth
objectives.
○ Track competitor activities and emerging trends within the equestrian niche
to inform and improve our social media strategy.

5. Ad Management (Optional):
○ Assist in managing paid social media campaigns, optimizing them for better
reach and conversion.
○ Collaborate with the team to create compelling ad content that drives traffic
to our e-commerce site.

Qualifications:
● Passion for Equestrian Lifestyle: A deep understanding and love for horses and
the equestrian community.
● Social Media Expertise: Proven experience in managing social media accounts,
particularly Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok.
● Creative Skills (a plus, but not required): Ability to create visually appealing and
engaging content that resonates with the equestrian audience.
● Marketing Knowledge: A background in marketing, especially within the
e-commerce space, is a plus.
● Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a strong
ability to engage with online communities.
● Analytical Skills: Experience with social media analytics tools and the ability to
make data-driven decisions.
Position Details:
● Type: Part-time (1 hour/day or 20-25 hours/month)
● Location: Remote
● Flexibility: Work flexible hours
● Reporting to: Agency Director and the Brand’s Digital Director
● Growth Potential: Limitless growth opportunities as the brand expands
● Compensation: This is a contract position that pays on an hourly basis ($20-$30/hr  plus significant bonuses based on performance.)

Title: Part Time Barn Staff
Content:
Grist Mill Farm, LLC is looking for part time barn help at our home barn in Plainville, MA. We are a small boutique barn with 6 horses under our care. Some previous horse experience (in any discipline) is necessary. We have a great group of horses and clients and are a stress free environment.

Tasks include but are not limited to:

  • Feeding grain & hay
  • Cleaning & filling water buckets
  • Turning horses out in paddocks
  • Stall cleaning ,
  • Grooming
  • Tacking & untacking horses
  • Bathing
  • Picking paddocks
  • Various maintenance/organizing projects around barn

Must be reliable, organized, and pay close attention to detail.

Opportunities to ride and travel to horse shows for right candidates
